story:
My name is Martin Franck Onambélé, and I am a Senior at Cornell University majoring in IARD (International Agriculture and Rural Development). I grew up in a rural neighboorhood in Oyak, Cameroon with a population of approximately 2000 people. Most people there did not have to opprotunites like me to travel, move away from poverty and get access to basic amenities such as water.

I was in Cameroon for an internship last Winter Break, where I worked with the Minister of Agriculture in different cities. When I went back to where I grew up, I was shocked that people still do not have access to clean water and they have to walk multiple miles to get access to water.

Clean water is distributed to this area once a week. The community faces challenges of water disparity and contamination. The portion of water that is distributed is not sustainable to carry one into the next week. sometime they have to wait for a car to run over a pipe and then they can collect water from the break in that pipe.There is water but people don't have access to it. I decided to create this project to bring water and development in this area.

My dream is to drill a sustainable well and build a water fountain that will make water access easier and safe for these people. But I cannot do that without your help. I will go back to Cameroon in July and I would like to start a fund raising campaign. The average cost of a well pump in Africa is $8,000 and my goal is to raise $5,000 of this $8,000, which means 2 dollars will give a person clean water each day. The purpose of the project is so that this community will have access to clean water 24/7 indefinitely. 

Please let the world know about this campaign and make some noise, share this page everyone can help. Any dollar will count towards this project and I cannot do it without your generosity. I appreciate it and thank you for your support.

story:
Our Story

My name is Henry Kiggundu (in white) and I am raising funds to help save my uncle's life (in pale blue shirt).  I am based in Boston now, and I come from a very humble family in Uganda. After my father's death in 2009, the head of the family became my uncle, Kyagulanyai.  Two weeks ago he was diagnosed with coronary artery disease, which means a clot in his main artery is threatening his life, constraining considerably his oxygen intake.  Right now he is only taking aspirin. He has developed high blood pressure, diabetes and high cholesterol. He gets a sharp pain (angina) unpredictably and as a consequence he becomes diaphoresis (short of breath).  His legs are swelling and the doctors say that his heart will stop (develop myocardio infraction) at some point if he doesn't get treatment.  The treatment is a stent surgery which is standard in the US, but unavailable in Uganda.  Being a third world country there are no resources for this kind of surgery.  The closest country where the surgery can be performed is South Africa, but it is prohibitively expensive.  The best option is Bombay, India, where they would charge $5000 USD for the surgery.   


We have tried so hard and managed to raise the money for the hotel in case he gets the surgery on time and generous people back home have offered to pay for the air tickets .  

I have personally $2000, a friend has given me $500, which means we need to raise $2500. 


The Impact

If you can contribute, even if it is $1, you would be helping to SAVE a life.   And his life means keeping one family and one community strong.  Kyagulanyai is a very kind and generous person. He has raised a family of 12 kids, always present, and has worked hard all his life (until he was asked to stop working because of his condition).  He is a member of 'Feed the Children' organisation, by helping collect food to deliver it to families that don't have the means.


What We Need & What You Get.

 $5000 covers the surgery and post-op recovery. I am giving my savings of $2000 and a friend already gave me $500. That means that,

we need only $2500.


This is what you get:

-  Should you be in Bakuli, Uganda at any point, one of my family members can be your tour guide. 

-  I can offer free volleyball lessons. I used to play for the Uganda national team. The lessons can be either in person (if you live close to the Boston area) or by skype if you want some advice.

- I will cook you a homemade traditional Ugandan meal and/or teach you how to make it.


If for some reason we can not get all the money and my uncle does not get the surgery, all the money will be refunded. This is why we are asking for fixed funding.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me spread the word. If you have any ideas that can help save my uncle's life, please send them in.  We are in dear need.

story:
Our Story

Heart & Hands Health Collective is a grassroots, hub for accessible, holistic health care in the heart of downtown Victoria BC and WE need your support. We provide Community Acupuncture, Chair Massage, Naturopathic Medicine and Herbal Medicine ALL at affordable, sliding scale rates.

In 2011, when we purchased our clinic property and we were informed that our current roof had about 5 years remaining on it. With the heavy rain this past winter, our roof has become compromised and it has since leaked into parts of our building including the electrical closet :(

We've shopped around and found a reputable roofing company, Custom Roofing, offering us the best bid on the market at $12 000.

 

Our challenge & why we need your help!

Not only are we facing a $12 000 roofing reno, BUT we also paid $8100 in property tax in July. That is a total of $21 000 in non-negotiable expenses. Presently, our small business can only afford one of these two necessary expenses and we need to repair the roof before the winter.

The cornerstone of Heart & Hands is TWO-FOLD:
1. We are committed to providing our community with affordable, accessible services at sliding scale rates. For many, we are their only option for holistic health care;
2. We are committed to providing our practitioners with a sustainable, living wage.

Being a creative, resourceful business, we’ve launched a series of fundraising efforts (May 1st Poke-a-thon + June Online Silent Auction), which includes *THIS* month long Indiegogo Crowdfunding campaign. We have $8 000 remaining to cover the cost of new roofing!!

Our challenge is quite simple, we need a new roof. BUT, what a new roof provides is something much larger than the building we inhabit. Heart & Hands is HOME to the practitioners, volunteers and 150+ weekly clients who depend on us to provide a space to work, rest and heal in. We are honored to create a meaningful connection between being an ethical business and being of service to the community. Having a new roof is an investment in our longevity, ensuring our clinic remains safe and warm for years to come!

 

And the fun stuff...the perks!!

We have created a list of thoughtful, heart-felt perks that showcase the services we provide, swag to show off your Heart & Hands pride as well as a selection of one-of-a-kind, handmade, locally-produced Heart & Hands items!

Treat yo' self or a loved one! Check out our awesome list of perks!
Check out some of the lovely things that are up for grabs,
http://heartandhandscommunity.ca/indiegogo-perks/

EMAIL US, if you live in Victoria and want to skip the shipping on your perk. We'll reply back with instructions on how to do so!

*Please note, you can still contribute WITHOUT picking a perk by clicking the PINK "BACK IT" button
**Victorians, we can also accept in-person donations at our Front Desk or at community events during the month of September!
 


Other Ways You Can Help!

We need your help to build another type of roof – one built of the stories of whose lives are enriched by our services and the outstanding care from the practitioners who provide it.

There are many ways to support us beyond a $ contribution:

  • SHARE our campaign on social media!
    Use the social media sharing buttons by the "BACK IT" button
  • Use word of mouth and/or distribute our flyers and posters
  • Tell YOUR story by writing something for Stories Under our Roof
  • Come in for an acu-nap and become part of our community :)
    BOOK ONLINE or call, 250-590-3185 to make your appointment today!

story:
Anchors Hair Company

Anchors Hair Company  is a care concept hair product line that first came to life as an idea to work alongside certain organizations to encourage confidence, hygiene and the will endeavor, to talented, purpose driven youth of the less fortunate class. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need a surplus of containers, labels, bulk ingredients, double boilers and hot plates to make more products. 

You get buttons, stickers, hair product, switch blade combs and the staisfaction in knowing you're investing in a company dedicated to bettering the world.

If we do not reach our goal, you will still get cool stuff in the mail. Who hates bills? We do! Who loves packages from cool hair product companies? We do!

About Anchors

My name is Benjamin David Miller and I believe that we are all meant to achieve the ultimate purpose of our lives and that this journey starts with true confidence and the feeling of self-worth. I want to encourage this process through great hair!  I’m new at this stuff, but I’m definitely ambitious about starting a successful hair product company with a cause. If you have any criticisms, suggestions and/or advice, PLEASE let me know.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute, PLEASE don't worry about it! Atleast watch our video and let it simmer. Also, contact us and say hey! And do us a favor and remember to always be kind and encouraging. There is not enough of that out in the world. We all very beautiful beings and Don't YOU forget it. 

Any questions, comments or concerns,

email: Benjamin @ AnchorsHairCo@gmail.com 

WWW.LOVEANCHORS.COM/WWW.ANCHORSHAIRCO.COM

 

We're so excited!! Thank you viewers and backers for giving us your time and money. You guys/gals are so amazing!!

story:
Qui sommes nous ? / About us

Bonjour, je m'appelle Catherine j'ai 55 ans et suis infirmière de nuit depuis plus de 30ans. Je monte ce projet avec ma fille Floriane, 28 ans, aide soignante de nuit depuis presque 10ans.

 

Hello, my name is Catherine I'm 55, I'm night nurse for over 30 years. I go up this project with my daughter Floriane, 28, nurse's aide at night for almost 10 years.

 

Que Présentons-nous ? / What do we want to do ?

VOS JOURS HEUREUX ! 

Au cours de nos pérégrinations professionnelles, nous avons souvent constater combien l'aidant était seul dans l'accompagnement de la personne âgée qu'il aime et soutient.

C'est pourquoi nous avons réfléchis à la création d'une structure d'accueil de courte durée pour personne âgée et/ou handicapée.

Afin de soulager les aidants et de répondre à leurs besoins, l'accueil se fera sur une durée de 4h, 8h, 24h, 5j ou 7j renouvelable trois fois (soit trois semaines consécutives).

La prise en charge sera effectuée par une aide-soignante pour 5 résidents épaulée par un animateur, dans un cadre idyllique au parc forestier du bois cassé, dans un site totalement clos avec vidéo-surveillance.

Auront lieu chaque jour de nombreuses animations, au gré des désirs des résidents. Il sera fait en moyenne deux fois par mois appel à une association d'artiste au chômage pour animer thé dansant, spectacle de magie ou encore pièce de théâtre. Un salon de coiffure, pédicure et esthétique sera à disposition des résidents, le but étant que chacun se sente comme chez soi tout en gardant une ouverture sur  le monde extérieur.

 

YOUR HAPPY DAYS!

 

During our professional wanderings we have frequently seen how the caregiver was alone in accompanying the elderly person he loves and supports.

That's why we think about creating a home for short-term elderly and / or disabled structure.

To relieve caregivers, and respond to their needs, Participants will be welcomed over a period of 4h, 8h, 24h, 5d and 7d renewable three times (three weeks).

Support shall be effected by a caregiver for 5 residents supported by a facilitator, in an idyllic setting in a forest park. A site completely enclosed with video surveillance.

Will take place every day, many events, according to the wishes of the residents. It will be done on average twice a month to call an association of artists to animate tea dance, magic show or play. A hairdresser, pedicure and beauty will be available to residents, with the aim that everyone feels at home while maintaining openness to the outside world.

 

Pourquoi ? / Why?

La place de la personne âgée, de la personne handicapée dans la société, le respect de sa dignité, de son intégrité, de son être même en tant que sujet, est l'affaire de tous :

c'est en ce sens que nous proposons ce projet

 

The place of the elderly, the place of disabled person in society, respect for their dignity, his integrity, his whole being as a subject, is everyone's business:

It is in this sense that we propose this project

 

Comment vous nous aiderez / How you will help us

Nous faisons appel à vos dons pour nous permettre de démarrer les travaux de mise aux normes de la structure afin de faire de ce lieu un espace convivial et respirant la joie.

La somme de 35000€ nous permettrait de faire débloquer le crédit de 450000€ demandé auprès des banques.

Nous utiliserions celui-ci pour réaliser sur une surface de 2000m2 : 

- 20 chambres d'une superficie de 22m2 avec salle de bain,

- un grand salon,

- une salle télévision,

- une salle de musique,

- plusieurs salles d'activités,

- le salon de coiffure/pédicure/esthétique

- une salle informatique équipée par nos soins

- une grande salle de festivité

- tout le mobilier et la décoration que nous souhaitons gaie et colorée

- une salle de repos pour le personnel

Ojectif atteind ou non le but reste le même !

 

 

We appeal to your donations to enable us to start work upgrading the structure in order to make this place a friendly and breathable joy.

The amount of € 35,000 would allow us to unlock the credit of € 450,000 requested from banks.

We would use it to make an area of 2000m2:

- 20 rooms with a surface of 22m2 with bathroom,

- A large living room,

- A TV room,

- A music room,

- Several activity rooms,

- A hairdresser / pedicure / aesthetic

- A computer room equipped by our care

- A large living festivity

- All the furniture and decoration that we want cheerful and colorful

- A rest room for staff

 

Reach the objective or not, the goal remains the same!

 

 

Ne soyez pas triste si vous ne pouvez pas nous aider financièrement, participez à votre manière, en nous faisant connaitre et en partageant ce projet via les outils indiegogo !

 

Do not be sad if you can not help us financially, you participate in your way. You can give us notoriety by sharing this project through tools INDIEGOGO!

story:
Short Summary


Thank you for taking the time to read my project,
For 18 years, I was a smoker. Even after trying E-cigs for the first time 7 years ago, I was still smoking Analogs. In the past few years, the market became customs and E-liquid was introduced. Until recently, most of the E-liquid on the market was made in China (Dekang), and I was still a smoker.

It wasn’t until local flavors came out that I finally stopped smoking; and, soon after that, I started making my own! I am now at the point where I have flavors of my own creation that I vape more than any E-liquid that I buy!

Now to the idea/issue: I have been passing liquids to friends and whoever asks, and have repeatedly received feedback that I should try my hand at selling my E-liquid flavors. I have always laughed it off, until now. My wife and I are expecting a baby girl, and recently found out that, while on maternity leave, my wife will only receive 55% of her current pay. We cannot survive on that, even with my salary.

So it seems the time has come to try and sell my E-Liquid.

What We Need & What You Get

As for what I need, I am looking for enough money to get my liquids online and in shops. I currently have around 12 flavors that are ready to go, and 15 more that I have been testing. What I am having a problem with follows:


• I have a website in process (Space and Domain is paid for  www.TheVapingDead.com), but the cost of the Shopping Cart/Processor is out of my reach coming out of pocket (Paypal doesn't support Vaping)

• The Price to get my LLC and TIN for California will take me a couple months out of pocket and with a child almost here that will be hard

• I need help to finish the logo and labels for bottles
• I need to acquire a stock of enough raw materials to support selling to shops, as most local vapor stores do not pay up-front, and I cannot afford to make the supply they are looking for out of pocket.

The Impact

This may not be seen as a true impact project; but through this whole process, I have helped many of my friends and acquaintances quit smoking.
Vaping is a significantly better for your health, and the health of those around you, which makes for overall better quality of life. Since I quit smoking, I have never felt better.
• The biggest impact of this to me is being able to support my family with another source of income, making sure I can keep a roof over my family’s head, and provide all that my wife and children deserve by taking on this extra work.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to read about and consider my project. I know it may be a long shot, but it never hurts to try and make my family’s life better by taking on some extra work.

Even if you cannot make a donation, please consider passing the word along to friends and family or on your social networking sites, and particularly to those who smoke and could stand to benefit from switching over to the healthier alternative of vaping!

Thank you again for your time,
Happy Vaping :)
Frank
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Thank you for taking the time to read my project, For 18 years, I was a smoker. Even after trying E-cigs for the first time 7 years ago, I was still smoking Analogs. In the past few years, the market became customs and E-liquid was introduced. Until recently, most of the E-liquid on the market was made in China (Dekang), and I was still a smoker.It wasn’t until local flavors came out that I finally stopped smoking; and, soon after that, I started making my own! I am now at the point where I have flavors of my own creation that I vape more than any E-liquid that I buy!Now to the idea/issue: I have been passing liquids to friends and whoever asks, and have repeatedly received feedback that I should try my hand at selling my E-liquid flavors. I have always laughed it off, until now. My wife and I are expecting a baby girl, and recently found out that, while on maternity leave, my wife will only receive 55% of her current pay. We cannot survive on that, even with my salary.So it seems the time has come to try and sell my E-Liquid. 
What We Need & What You Get
As for what I need, I am looking for enough money to get my liquids online and in shops. I currently have around 12 flavors that are ready to go, and 15 more that I have been testing. What I am having a problem with follows:

•	I need help to finish the logo and labels for bottles•	I need to acquire a stock of enough raw materials to support selling to shops, as most local vapor stores do not pay up-front, and I cannot afford to make the supply they are looking for out of pocket.

The Impact

Since I quit smoking, I have never felt better.•	The biggest impact of this to me is being able to support my family with another source of income, making sure I can keep a roof over my family’s head, and provide all that my wife and children deserve by taking on this extra work.

story: On March 4th there is an Amerian Cancer Society marathon and half marathon in New Orlans, LA...it's called THE ROCk AND ROLL! One of my very good friends, Danny Vanaphan, who also works with me at HBU MHW, and is also an AMAZING TRAINER (big shout outs, lol) has been bugging me to run in one of these with him for a long time. To tell you the truth, this has always been a goal of mine, but I've always been a lil scared to jump in head first. Well, as you can all tell, I've been thinking about James A LOT and how he has just managed to jump in and fight this cancer with a smile on his face, I'm sure he doesn't always FEEL like smiling, but...he doesn't let that stop him! So, what am I afraid of? His fight is so much harder, why am I being a WHIMP? I just signed up for the HALF MARATHON (BABY STEPS...) and I am running in honor of 4 people in my life...my brother, David, who is a throat cancer SURVIVOR, my mother in law, Ramona, who is a throat cancer SURVIVOR...they were both diagnosed and went through treatment around the same time....I just lost a friend, Keasha, to lung cancer last month...she was 38 and never smoked a day in her life....and then, there is JAMES DAY, 13 YEARS OLD, WHO IS CURRENTLY FIGHTNG AND WILL WIN HIS BATTLE AGAINST GERMINOMA! JAMES HAS PROVEN TO MANY THAT HE IS A FIGHTER AND HIS SMILE IS LIGHTING UP HIS FACEBOOK GROUP PAGE EVERY DAY! I LOVE THIS!!! I am not only going to be running for him but this fundraiser is dedicated to James and his family. My Goal is to raise $10,000 before March 4 with all proceeds to got to Jamie, Val and James Day to help with there upcoming travels for radiation treaments...The radiation treatment that James needs is called PENCIL BEAM PROTON and is not available in Maine where James lives. The family will have to travel in order to receive this treatment that will be so much more gentle on James' recovery process. It is going to be a costly venture, but a much more gentle and positive treatment for James. I am really excited James is a candidate for this treatment and want to help The Day Family make this treatment possible by helping them finacially...PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE if you are able to donate in ANY denomination it would be so greatly appreciated! please visit James' facebook group page to read his postings and view many pictures! http://www.facebook.com/SHANNONEWESLEY#!/groups...

story:
Kylie was a normal little girl growing up having fun and doing what kids do, until the fall of 2009. At that time she developed sever abdomial pain and was in and out of every hospital in the area. Finally they removed her galbladder but that did nothing but put her through more trauma. After 1-1/2 yrs the stress of the constant pain not only kept her out of school but she lost several years of her memory. We live a in a small town and good medical help has been hard to find. She was accepted into the Mayo clinic, but our insurance did not have out of state coverage. It's been about 3 years now and she has learned to cope with it but still does not have anything close to a normal life.

I cut a portion of an artical that the local paper did on Kylie when she was "adopted" by the Sparrow Club last year. This is a portion of that article;

Kylie Cross has a favorite quote: "I don't need easy, I just need possible."

A little over a year ago, Cross lost most of her short term and childhood memories. She returned to a school where she couldn't remember her friends.

She had suffered from a seizure and sustained permanent memory damage.

Unfortunately, that's one of many medical problems Kylie has struggled through in her short life. Kylie has gone through far more than the average sophomore at Sisters High School.

Instead of worrying about the PSAT or sports practice, she is dealing with Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome, and symptoms such as severe abdominal pain, respiratory issues, hallucinations, and fainting, which doctors have been unable to accurately diagnose. Just six weeks ago she underwent surgery for intestinal bleeding.

For Kylie, returning to social life at school after her seizure was "a bit awkward". Without many of her memories and unable to pursue her passion for sports, she felt disconnected...

For the full artical, please see: http://www.nuggetnewspaper.com/main.asp?SectionID=8&SubSectionID=8&ArticleID=19613

Julianne... une petite fille unique dans sa différence !

Vous êtes très nombreux à suivre la petite vie de Julianne, me demander des nouvelles de nos différents rdv et je vous en remercie, c'est vraiment agréable de se sentir soutenu, surtout dans ces conditions, pas forcément les plus agréables à vivre au quotidien pour nous et notre famille.

Vous me connaissez, la communication est mon métier, mais quand cela me touche directement, c'est un peu plus dur... Mais voilà, je vais essayer de vous faire comprendre ce qu'il se passe le plus simplement possible.

Il y a 3 ans, notre vie a drastiquement changé le jour de la naissance de Julianne. Nouvelle adaptation avec l'arrivée d'un bébé, qui, malade depuis la naissance, nous fait vivre de très durs moments… mais aussi des meilleurs, la plupart du temps, en tous cas ceux que l'on essaie de retenir le plus.

Il s'en est suivi une adaptation forcée dans ma vie professionnelle (qui d'ailleurs fonctionne bien grâce à certains d'entre vous en partie !) et d'autres, ailleurs : une chance, merci !

Marie-Ève m'épaule du mieux qu'elle peut et s'occupe un peu plus de Julianne, ce qui me laisse un peu de temps pour faire connaître/ grandir notre entreprise familiale que j'espère pouvoir encore développer dès mon retour au Québec; on en reparlera, mais sachez que si vous voulez nous aider, tous mes contacts, mais aussi les vôtres seront importants, je vous explique pourquoi !

Julianne est passée depuis 3 ans dans les mains d’innombrables spécialistes du corps médical, sans résultats par rapport à ses symptômes. Baladés d’un hôpital à un autre, dans des services variés, dans les mains de spécialistes au Québec, mais aussi en France, nous avons pu ‘’toucher’’ les meilleurs dans leurs domaines, notamment et grâce à mon grand frère, médecin, présentement à la très prestigieuse École de Guerre à Paris, qui a pu nous ouvrir la porte à de nouvelles techniques/ technologies qui n’existent qu’en France pour le moment.

À l’hôpital Necker, à Paris, l’un des plus gros centres pédiatrique au monde et surtout l’un des plus avancés en génétique, nous avons fait les derniers tests et commencé à prendre les dispositions pour non pas guérir Julianne (elle ne pourra pas l’être), mais pouvoir poser un diagnostic (si c’est un jour possible), avancer dans notre vie, et éventuellement faire grandir notre famille, tout en ayant le choix de la décision dès la conception si cela devait se reproduire.

Nous en avons profité pour rencontrer le neurologue, LE professeur pédiatrique, la généticienne et afin d’avancer dans ce sens, avons fait des prises de sang pour qu’ils aient tous les outils en main afin de travailler.

Les résultats de l’IRM tant attendu sont revenus normaux, ce qui est un soulagement ! Les seuls examens restant, il n’en existe plus que 2 à faire, sont à effectuer en France, là où le Québec ne peut malheureusement plus aider… Ces 2 tests sont les derniers.

Le premier, plus précis, va aller chercher dans plus de 250 gênes connus et essayer de voir s’il y aurait deux gênes qui ensemble, ont provoqué les problèmes de notre petit ange. Cet examen coûte cher, très cher = +/2500 euros. Le second, un test dit de ‘’recherche’’ appelé l’Exome, va lui chercher parmi 20000 gênes et tenter de faire le même exercice, exercice ultra complexe car moins ciblé : on rentre dans le domaine de la recherche pure et donc va nécessiter encore des milliers d’euros !...

Si on trouve quelque chose avec le premier test génétique effectué parmi ces 250 gênes connus, nous saurons alors à quoi s’en tenir. Un gêne de chaque côté qui mis ensemble, produit une réaction menant à cette ‘’erreur’’ génétique. Résultat = 1 chance sur 4 d’avoir un autre enfant comme Julianne… Une hypothétique amiosynthèse pourrait alors confirmer le diagnostic et la décision à prendre en conséquence : elle est déjà évidente ! Nous allons devoir attendre encore un minimum de 6 mois ‘’réalistement’’ pour avoir une réponse à Paris l’année prochaine.

Si on ne trouve pas, ce sera l’Exome, s’il est réalisable avec les moyens engendrés et demandés. Nous rentrerions donc dans une phase de recherches de maladie orphelines (inconnues). Délai attendu pour des premiers résultats d’une année au minimum…

Si rien n’est trouvé, la conclusion serait un ‘’accident’’ pendant la conception, les risques alors ‘’minimes’’ quant à avoir un autre enfant comme Julianne, mais rien pour nous rassurer et nous pousser dans cette voix là, vous l'imaginez !...

Et pour finir, nous avons parlé du futur de Julianne, ce qui allait potentiellement lui arriver vu son état actuel. Il fallait s’y attendre, les nouvelles ne sont pas bonnes.

Julianne a un déficit intellectuel lourd, et le gardera probablement toute sa vie. La marche est envisageable, il va falloir travailler dur, très dur, encore plus dur, mais ce n’est pas exclu. Le langage va par contre être très très compliqué, voir impossible. Tout est lié, le langage vient avec la compréhension… et Julianne est très en retard par rapport à la ‘’normalité’’. Nous devrons donc penser à terme à nous rapprocher de grands centres où tout est fait pour des enfants comme Julianne et là où une intention particulière est donnée aux enfants handicapés… Trouver d'autres moyens de communications, etc etc.

Vous l’aurez compris, il m’a fallu quelques longues heures de réflexion avant d’écrire ce message et vous tenir informé.
Vous l’aurez aussi compris, nous allons avoir besoin de toute l’aide possible dans toutes ces démarches, dures pour nous, dures pour Julianne et pour toute sa famille sur tous les plans…

Donc, et si vous avez des idées pour nous aider à trouver des fonds pour payer toutes ces dépenses astronomiques (la seule journée passée à Necker pour effectuer les tests a coûté + de 1000 euros + les 3 billets d'avion + les dépenses sur place ++), si vous avez des contacts qui ont besoin de sites web, si vous connaissez des personnes qui seraient prêtes à parrainer Julianne financièrement, nous sommes à l’écoute de tout, de vous…

Merci d’avance pour Julianne, notre petit ange de la différence, afin de lui permettre de vivre une vie, la plus normale possible !

Benjamin, papa de Julianne

story:
The Next Web | TechCrunch | GizMag | VentureBeat | WARE | CNET | GeekWire


 



 




Spritz has been working for nearly 3 years in “Stealth Mode” to perfect their reading methodology. Introducing the first wearable to use Spritz Technology.


Get to know Spritz Reading Technology

 When reading, only around 20% of your time is spent processing content.

 

Traditional Reading, RSVP & Spritzing

Reading becomes more efficient because Spritzing decreases time searching for the next word’s ORP “Optimal Recognition Point”.












 

GOOGLE FIT API

Developer Preview: https://developers.google.com/fit/preview

Google Fit is an open ecosystem that allows developers to upload fitness data to a central repository where users can access their data from different devices and apps in one location:

  • Fitness apps can store data from any wearable or sensor.
  • Fitness apps can access data created by any app.
  • User's fitness data is persisted when they upgrade their fitness devices.

Google Fit is officially released in Fall 2014. The preview release contains the Google Fit APIs for Android, but it does not contain the REST API or the Android Wear APIs, which will be included in the official release.


APPLE HEALTH API

Developer Beta: https://developer.apple.com/healthkit/

Like Google Fit, Apple’s HealthKit allows apps that provide health and fitness services to share their data with the new Health app and with each other. A user’s health information is stored in a centralized and secure location and the user decides which data should be shared with your app.

Find us on LinkedIn:

Mark | Edmund | Clem | Samantha

story:
Hello, this is Be.

Who am i and what the heck am i up to  now..??  

I am a crisis mental health support worker, advocate for persons of varying abilities, aspiring herbalist and student of Plant Spirit Medicine. My deepest passion is to see balance restored to all beings through heart centred re-integration of humankind with the Divine Natural World.

Currently i am approaching the half way point in my training to become a Plant Spirit Medicine practitioner. (http://www.plantspiritmedicine.org/)

My teachers are Tsaurirrikame Eliot Cowan, (a fully intiated senior shaman in the Huichol tradition of Western Mexico,) and Granicera Alison Gayek (weather shaman in the Nahua tradition indigenous to Central Mexico)    

How this medicine works...      

 By blending eastern five element diagnostics and shamanism and differing from many other forms of herbalism in the importance placed on the personal relationships between plants, client and practitioner, this medicine is gentle but deeply effective.    Without treating symptoms and by looking at the whole person, the practitioner diagnosis the root of a persons' imbalance and identifies blocks to be cleared in much the same way an acupuncturist would. But instead of using needles the practioner calls upon Plant Spirits to do the work of clearing and rebalancing...'needleless needles'. The results are extraordinary. Deep and enduring healing is available for body, mind and spirit. 

For many folks the thought of spirits even existing other than in the human context seems outrageous, but it really is a relatively new attitude. The ancients governed their lives according to the belief that ALL is Spirit-therefore sacred and powerful and to be treated as such. 

In my experience over the years i have often felt helpless in the face of the pain and destruction i've witnessed in the lives of countless individuals as well as in my own life. To me it seems clear that we, as humans are desperately out of balance and as a result have brought ourselves and the rest of Earth's inhabitants into a very desperate state. Plant Spirits know this and are eagerly waiting to interact with us in a respectful, healing way to bring us back into right relationship with them and all other beings.

Funding for this training enables me to bring this potent medicine to my community where it is urgently needed. Upon graduation I intend to set up a healing practice in my home to begin with and eventually other places in the future. I also intend to offer workshops and spiritual spa days as a space to share indigenous teachings once i have completed my intiations.  and as with everything i do, i intend to make it accessible-working within folk's budgets. i continue to be open to trade and barter situations that honour both human parties as well as the medicine itself.

What i need and where the funds will be going...

i work full time to support a family of four. Situations being as they are right now leave little room for additional costs. All funds received from this campaign will go towards my tuition costs plus room and board and travel costs for the next bunch of months until i graduate (early 2013). Costs per week long stay is $1700US plus $200-$300US/CDN travel roundtrip. I have 5 more sessions to attend. I'm required to be on the land to study every 3 months or so.

The story of this sacred land and home for indigenous teachings can be found here- (http://www.bluedeer.org/)
 
 What you receive...

I can offer a wide range of services in exchange for your support. I've spent many years compiling a 'toolbox' of both a physical and spiritual nature and anywhere in between. Chakra and body frequency balancing, distance readings, green home cleaning, energetic space clearing, ecstatic or eco-contemplative movement classes, vegan cooking, and traditional assessments, etc.
 
Other ways to contribute...

'Let's give 'em something to talk about...', Spreading the word about this campaign and this beautiful medicine through any social media or word of mouth is a great gift. 
 
Also-as a favour to yourself and to me-go to the woods or any natural place and begin to connect with the Plant Spirits by gifting some tobacco, a gemstone, food, a song or prayer and then waiting quietly with an open heart to hear Their voices. Over time you'll be surprised and delighted with the results in your own life. I promise.
 
Thank you for taking the time to peruse here.
May the magic and medicine of our plant relatives bless you...
With love and deepest gratitude,
Be
story_txt:
Hello, this is Be.
Who am i and what the heck am i up to  now..??   
I am a crisis mental health support worker, advocate for persons of varying abilities, aspiring herbalist and student of Plant Spirit Medicine. My deepest passion is to see balance restored to all beings through heart centred re-integration of humankind with the Divine Natural World.
Currently i am approaching the half way point in my training to become a Plant Spirit Medicine practitioner. (http://www.plantspiritmedicine.org/)
My teachers are Tsaurirrikame Eliot Cowan, (a fully intiated senior shaman in the Huichol tradition of Western Mexico,) and Granicera Alison Gayek (weather shaman in the Nahua tradition indigenous to Central Mexico)    
How this medicine works...       
 By blending eastern five element diagnostics and shamanism and differing from many other forms of herbalism in the importance placed on the personal relationships between plants, client and practitioner, this medicine is gentle but deeply effective.    Without treating symptoms and by looking at the whole person, the practitioner diagnosis the root of a persons' imbalance and identifies blocks to be cleared in much the same way an acupuncturist would. But instead of using needles the practioner calls upon Plant Spirits to do the work of clearing and rebalancing...'needleless needles'. The results are extraordinary. Deep and enduring healing is available for body, mind and spirit. 
For many folks the thought of spirits even existing other than in the human context seems outrageous, but it really is a relatively new attitude. The ancients governed their lives according to the belief that ALL is Spirit-therefore sacred and powerful and to be treated as such. 
In my experience over the years i have often felt helpless in the face of the pain and destruction i've witnessed in the lives of countless individuals as well as in my own life. To me it seems clear that we, as humans are desperately out of balance and as a result have brought ourselves and the rest of Earth's inhabitants into a very desperate state. Plant Spirits know this and are eagerly waiting to interact with us in a respectful, healing way to bring us back into right relationship with them and all other beings.
Funding for this training enables me to bring this potent medicine to my community where it is urgently needed. Upon graduation I intend to set up a healing practice in my home to begin with and eventually other places in the future. I also intend to offer workshops and spiritual spa days as a space to share indigenous teachings once i have completed my intiations.  and as with everything i do, i intend to make it accessible-working within folk's budgets. i continue to be open to trade and barter situations that honour both human parties as well as the medicine itself.
What i need and where the funds will be going... 
i work full time to support a family of four. Situations being as they are right now leave little room for additional costs. All funds received from this campaign will go towards my tuition costs plus room and board and travel costs for the next bunch of months until i graduate (early 2013). Costs per week long stay is $1700US plus $200-$300US/CDN travel roundtrip. I have 5 more sessions to attend. I'm required to be on the land to study every 3 months or so.

The story of this sacred land and home for indigenous teachings can be found here- (http://www.bluedeer.org/)
 
 What you receive...


I can offer a wide range of services in exchange for your support. I've spent many years compiling a 'toolbox' of both a physical and spiritual nature and anywhere in between. Chakra and body frequency balancing, distance readings, green home cleaning, energetic space clearing, ecstatic or eco-contemplative movement classes, vegan cooking, and traditional assessments, etc.
 
Other ways to contribute...

Also-as a favour to yourself and to me-go to the woods or any natural place and begin to connect with the Plant Spirits by gifting some tobacco, a gemstone, food, a song or prayer and then waiting quietly with an open heart to hear Their voices. Over time you'll be surprised and delighted with the results in your own life. I promise.
 
Thank you for taking the time to peruse here.

With love and deepest gratitude,
Be

story:
Short Summary

Tasia Ray Hymas was born on July 23, 1992 to Teasa Bledsoe and David Hymas. Teasa met Dennis S Kinder when Tasia was 8 mo. old and he became her life long father. Tasia grew up in a happy home and always had a beautiful smile. Tasia did all she can to help animals and everyone around her. Tasia moved from St. George Utah to Salt Lake City late last year to pursue school and learning. On February 19, 2012 Tasia was traveling home with some friends when the car they were driving hit some black ice and rolled several times, ejecting Tasia and ending her short life all to soon.

What We Need & What You Get

Dennis and Teasa are not in agreat position to pay all the money for her funeral. Unfortunatley, they had to get multiple loans to pay for the sudden tragedy. They are now facing a hardship of trying to pay those bills and still supply for a family. They need your help.

The Impact

All of the $6200 (besides the Indiegogo fees) will be going to pay back the loans for this family. As well as ensure a future for their small family.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not only do donations help, but just a matter of spreading the word. So, if you can't donate, please share. 

To find out more go to: www.ksl.com/?nid=148&sid=19295207

story:
We’re turning to you to secure this round of funding, and your advice and feedback as we build and deliver the next key features of the app. To make sure we build the right features, we'll give you free access to our prototype as soon as you back this project (see perks descriptions on the right for details). With your support, we can use science and technology to make training a rewarding experience, simple, and fun again.

 

"Hi, my name is Christelle Bouchard. I've been helping Dr. Juneau with customer service for 3 years. And I'm proud our customers say we have 'the best customer service'". -Christelle Bouchard, support@drmuscleapp.com

 

"The best customer service" -Bob McDermott

"Dr. Muscle has the best customer service. Dr. Juneau and Christelle, his excellent assistant, take the time to help and answer questions you might have. So if you are on the fence for purchasing the app, go for it. You won't be disappointed." -Bob McDermott, early access customer

We believe your experience with us should be smooth and a solid 10/10. You can call us at +1 (514) 608-1057, Monday to Friday, 1:00 to 5:00 pm, Eastern time. We reply to most emails the same day. And our stats show most customers are either happy. See for yourself:

 

Works On All Phones & In All Gyms

 

 

Dr. Muscle works on all iPhones, Android phones, and tablets. So even if you change your phone, you'll still have your workout data.

 

 

Bodyweight, home gym, or gym? We got you covered. You can start from home with just your body weight. Get a few pairs of dumbells, and you can do the home gym programs. More avanced? Dr. Muscle can guide you in the most hardcore of gyms.

 

Expert reviews

"Lift weights. You'll look and feel years younger. And this new technology may be the easiest and cheapest way to get there fast."

"Ever since I got hit by a car in college, I've looked for new and better ways to become healthy, lean, and fit. AI is the next frontier in fitness, and if you're doing any form of weight lifting, you should definitely check this new technology out."

"90% of people over the age of 35 lose enough muscle every year to burn off an additional 4 pounds of body fat. Don't let this happen to you. Lift weights. You'll look and feel years younger. And this new technology may be the easiest and cheapest way to get there fast."

-John Rowley, best-selling co-author of "Old School New Body"

"This app could get a whole lot of people on track integrating the modern science-based approach to building muscle mass and strength"

"This new app looks like a winner. The app figures out sets, reps, volume, loading, and so forth, and does a damn good job of delivering a customized workout based on the individuals progress – or lack there of – using what’s called  “Daily Undulating Periodization” or DUP."

"Short of paying a good strength coach, this app could get a whole lot of people on track integrating the modern science-based approach to building muscle mass and strength while reducing the likelihood injuries and removing the guess work. So far, feedback from BrinkZone users of the app has been excellent."

-Will Brink, SWAT Trainer, Magazine Columnist (Over 50 mags in 9 countries), and author of Bodybuilding Revealed

"Transform your body even if you can't afford a personal trainer"

"In 2011, I became the WBFF Pro Bodybuilding World Champion. My secret? Dedication, motivation, and determination. You'll need all 3 to transform your body."  

"What you'll also need is a sound training program. If you can afford it, a real, human personal trainer is the way to go. But this app may just be the next best thing."  

"I've seen what it can do. It creates a customized workout program for you. Then, as you do it, it tells you exactly how much to lift, and how many reps and sets you should be doing. It's also surprisingly accurate. With this app, you can train smart and transform your body even if you can't afford a personal trainer. I think it has a lot of potential."

-Matt Stirling, Certified Personal Trainer, WBFF Bodybuilding World Champ, 2-Time Musclemania World Champion, and author of The Customized Carb Cycling Solution

 

Customer reviews

"I'm stronger at 58 than when I was 27!!" -Silver Dakota, early access customer

"I am a physical therapist that was unfortunately injured on a roller coaster. One cervical spinal fusion later I found myself much weaker than I thought I ever would be. I am happy to say that since using this app safely, and within my tolerance level, my strength (and arms) are coming back to pre-injury levels. I am so happy with my results!" -Marie Francis, early access customer

"This is whats been missing on the market. Wow! This app Knows exactly how to challenge you. I've gone from bench pressing 100 kg to 120 in just 3 months." -Funkybizz, early access customer

"Today my bud said that my arms are looking bigger than when he saw me three weeks ago. This means that Dr. Muscle is working as it is the only training resource that I’ve been using. With all the mess that I experienced earlier this year transitioning to a new health-club and adjusting to working out on my own I’m proud of myself for getting back into fitness and ditching expensive personal trainers with the help of this cool muscle building app." -Remone Mundle, early access customer

"Amazing, accurate, and logical to follow. Everything Dr. Juneau incorporates into his program is based on CURRENT scientific research and he doesn't deviate from that; ever, which I totally respect in this "profit first" culture we live in when he could be tempted to tell you B.S. just to get customers to spend more. I've taught science for 30 years and been a weight lifter for the majority of my life. This is easily, without exception, the best program and app available and it is literally customized to your own strength and experience. Seriously, ALL of the exercises, weights, sets, reps, on-the-spot self-evaluation, change in routine, time in between sets, and EVEN the gains you made both numeric and graphed are in this app. It's absolutely incredible and in my opinion revolutionary in the market. I wish I had this 40 years ago, but I don't think Dr. Muscle was around back then! Along with my gym membership, it's the best weight lifting money I've spent in my life and I give it my highest recommendation! Thanks Carl!!!" -Jim Clift, early access customer

 

A Personal Invitation From Dr. Carl Juneau

If you're looking to get in shape in 2019, then this may be the most important invitation you get this year.

My name is Dr. Carl Juneau. I’m an exercise scientist with a PhD in health statistics. I’ve been a coach all my life and a trainer for the Canadian Forces. I’ve helped about 10,000 people get in shape 1-on-1, in group classes, and online.

That’s how I found out that training is hard. It requires time, knowledge, and motivation. And just when you think you’re doing everything right, you can still get injured, get stuck, or lose motivation, and quit. And when you quit, you lose all your gains, and you and have to start all over again… And if that’s ever happened to you, you know how tough that is. Take it from me: I know.

In 2009, suddenly, I had trouble eating. I had no energy, couldn’t train, and felt my IQ had dropped 15 points. I used to get on the scale at least once a week to track my progress. But I stopped doing that: it was becoming too painful to see I was losing all the gains I’d worked so hard to make. Have a look:

On this chart, on the left, you can see that in 2005, when I got on the scale for the first time, I weighed 143 lbs. In 2009, 4 years later, I had gained 18 lbs of muscle. I was proud of that!

But by 2010, I was down to 140 lbs—see that big dip on the right?

What happened is I had become intolerant to gluten. But doctors took 1 year to find out. So that year, I couldn't eat, couldn't train, and I ended up lighter than when I first started out.

4 years of training: gone—just like that!

By 2011, I had learned to manage gluten. I moved to London (England) for my PhD. And I started training with Dave Beattie.

Dave was a 5-time world champion in powerlifting, and world-record holder in the squat. He had a really no-nonsense approach to training (that contrasted with my obsessive-compulsive style). We were training, and he would just say: do that. Do this. That was it. And...

I gained back 21 lbs in 3 months

Now granted, when you gain back muscle you’ve lost, it’s quicker. But still, in 3 months, I gained as much muscle as I had in 4 years.

When I started out, my mistake was that I desperately wanted to discover the best workout plan. I read tons of books to find the best exercises, how long to do them, how many times, how many times a week, and the perfect mix that would get me in great shape... in no time. So that I could get more attention and more respect! But that’s actually a mistake. And here’s why:

Even the best workout is almost guaranteed to fail you... at some point

While there may be a "best" workout plan for you now… That plan is almost guaranteed to stop working in the future. Because your body adapts. So if you keep on doing the same workout... even the BEST workout... you’ll start to notice you’re not improving as fast as you used to.

Plus, you just might get bored. And when you mix these 2 things, you’re setting yourself up to lose motivation, and quit. And if you're tough, and you really stick with it, you can end up overtrained, and injured. That’s what I was doing, and I was running around in circles with my training... wondering why the other guys were getting bigger, faster, and stronger, and I wasn't keeping up.

What I should have done, and what you should do, is to focus on a single fundamental training principle. Every good trainers knows this. My coach Dave in London knew it. In fact, it's exactly what the American College of Sports Medicine recommends (ACSM, 2009).

And that principle is progressive overload. Progressive overload just means that to get in better shape, you need to "overload" your workout…

But the way you "overload" has to be very specific: you must increase at least one of the major training variables of your workout progressively... So that you keep on challenging your body to transform.

Just by increasing the load, or repeating each exercise more times, you make your body think:

"Oh dear! This is new, and unexpected—I need to improve!"

And your body will improve and adapt by building muscle and burning fat. Over time, men usually end up quite muscular, and women, more sculpted; and both get leaner.

Plus, when you improve your fitness:

  • Your improve your health
  • Your improve your looks
  • Your improve your energy
  • Your improve your strength
  • Your improve your muscle mass
  • Your improve your confidence
  • Your improve your mood

You even improve your sex life!

You improve your self. I believe in self-improvement, and I really believe getting in shape is one of the best ways you can improve. It’s helped me tremendously.

But to make it work for you, your workout needs to start at your level, and improve with you. And the best way to ensure that, is to let a personal trainer guide you, motivate you, and update your plan in real time, as you do it. But trainers are expensive…

I know: I’ve been a trainer for 18 years. Here are just some of the men and women I've helped:

Now their results are not typical, and if you really want to get in shape, you'll need time, knowledge, and motivation. That’s why training is hard. And why so many people fail.

You know you’re failing when you’re training and you’re not improving… Or worse: you’ve given up. You’re not training. And now you’re out of shape:

You have no stamina—you get out breath when you walk up stairs, and soon your clothes don’t fit

Deep down, you’re not proud of yourself, and you know you gotta do something. Just like a friend of mine. A few years ago, he started training with me an hour 3 days a week.

He’s a large dude, and in 2 months, he was lifting 300 lbs (that’s good by any standard). But then he had to skip a week because of work... then he got sick... one thing led to another, and he never came back. These days, he’s completely out of shape, and I really hate to see it.

I hate to see people fail at training. It's had such a big impact on my life, I’ve always wanted to help more people succeed at it, and change their life. But when I work as a personal trainer, I feel stuck, helping clients 1-on-1. Plus, it's just too expensive for most people. I had to find a better way.

So, in 2016, I finished my PhD, I gathered a small team, and we started building this new technology. Our vision was to give you the ability to improve almost as fast as if you had trainer, but for much cheaper.

With this technology, you apply all the latest science and the proven tricks of an experienced trainer automatically. Under the hood, your training is built around progressive overload (the fundamental principle we've just discussed). Your program updates in real time as you do it, so you always get in shape as fast as possible.

Here's why you'll get in shape faster with Dr. Muscle...

It's more advanced. Your program:

  • Starts at your level after a quick 1-time, 7-tap setup
  • Levels up with you, adding new exercises as you become more experienced, fitter, and stronger
  • Updates in real time as you work out with the best mix of reps, sets, and rest, so you always get in shape as fast as possible

Plus!

It's more fun. As one early access customer put it: "It's like a surprise every workout".

It's easy and fast. Your workout is ready at the push of a button. You'll save time.

You'll never lose your data. Your workout data is backed up safely in the cloud, so even if you lose your phone, you'll never lose your progress. Simply log in, and you can resume where you left off.

Exercise by exercise, workout by workout, Dr. Muscle can take you from the beginner stage to the advanced level. It automates almost everything, through the entire process. It guides you like a personal trainer, but it’s 10 times cheaper, always up to date, and available anytime, anywhere.

Risks & challenges

We’ve been building this app for 2 years. To be honest, it wasn't easy. We started out with just 3 people, an idea, and little money. I wasn't sure the idea would stick. The main risk was spending all the money we could raise to build our prototype, just to see it fail.

But today, we’ve already fine tuned our prototype with data from 655 early access customers. We make enough money to keep the ball rolling, so we're here to stay. How much funding we get will influence how fast we implement our next features, so you don't risk backing this project and getting nothing in return. In fact, you'll get access to our prototype right away.

Building the right features is another challenge. My job is to make sure we build the features you want. My boss is you. To get your feedback, we've set up a special website. There, customers (like yourself?) get to suggest and vote for new features. We implement features with the most votes first, and we've already implemented 5 major features that way. So, we really value customer feedback. And when you become a customer, we will reach out and want to hear from you.

You can do this!

Training changed my life. I've seen it change the lives of hundreds of people. And it could change your life, too. By giving you strength, discipline, energy, and confidence. But it's hard. That's why we've made Dr. Muscle as easy to use as possible. It automates almost everything. It guides you in real time, and motivates you to get in shape. It's available anytime, anywhere. We're making training a rewarding experience, simple, and fun again. Come get in shape and improve with us. It could change your life.

I moved to London (England) for my PhD. And I started training with Dave Beattie.Dave was a 5-time world champion in powerlifting, and world-record holder in the squat. He had a really no-nonsense approach to training (that contrasted with my obsessive-compulsive style). We were training, and he would just say: do that. Do this. That was it. And...I gained back 21 lbs in 3 monthsNow granted, when you gain back muscle you’ve lost, it’s quicker. But still, in 3 months, I gained as much muscle as I had in 4 years.When I started out, my mistake was that I desperately wanted to discover the best workout plan. I read tons of books to find the best exercises, how long to do them, how many times, how many times a week, and the perfect mix that would get me in great shape... in no time. So that I could get more attention and more respect! But that’s actually a mistake. And here’s why:Even the best workout is almost guaranteed to fail you... at some pointWhile there may be a "best" workout plan for you now… That plan is almost guaranteed to stop working in the future. Because your body adapts. So if you keep on doing the same workout... even the BEST workout... you’ll start to notice you’re not improving as fast as you used to.Plus, you just might get bored. And when you mix these 2 things, you’re setting yourself up to lose motivation, and quit. And if you're tough, and you really stick with it, you can end up overtrained, and injured. That’s what I was doing, and I was running around in circles with my training... wondering why the other guys were getting bigger, faster, and stronger, and I wasn't keeping up.What I should have done, and what you should do, is to focus on a single fundamental training principle. Every good trainers knows this. My coach Dave in London knew it. In fact, it's exactly what the American College of Sports Medicine recommends (ACSM, 2009).And that principle is progressive overload. Progressive overload just means that to get in better shape, you need to "overload" your workout…But the way you "overload" has to be very specific: you must increase at least one of the major training variables of your workout progressively... So that you keep on challenging your body to transform.Just by increasing the load, or repeating each exercise more times, you make your body think:"Oh dear! This is new, and unexpected—I need to improve!"And your body will improve and adapt by building muscle and burning fat. Over time, men usually end up quite muscular, and women, more sculpted; and both get leaner.Plus, when you improve your fitness:
Your improve your health
Your improve your looks
Your improve your energy
Your improve your strength
Your improve your muscle mass
Your improve your confidence
Your improve your mood
You even improve your sex life!You improve your self. I believe in self-improvement, and I really believe getting in shape is one of the best ways you can improve. It’s helped me tremendously.But to make it work for you, your workout needs to start at your level, and improve with you. And the best way to ensure that, is to let a personal trainer guide you, motivate you, and update your plan in real time, as you do it. But trainers are expensive…I know: I’ve been a trainer for 18 years. Here are just some of the men and women I've helped:Now their results are not typical, and if you really want to get in shape, you'll need time, knowledge, and motivation. That’s why training is hard. And why so many people fail.You know you’re failing when you’re training and you’re not improving… Or worse: you’ve given up. You’re not training. And now you’re out of shape:You have no stamina—you get out breath when you walk up stairs, and soon your clothes don’t fitDeep down, you’re not proud of yourself, and you know you gotta do something. Just like a friend of mine. A few years ago, he started training with me an hour 3 days a week.He’s a large dude, and in 2 months, he was lifting 300 lbs (that’s good by any standard). But then he had to skip a week because of work... then he got sick... one thing led to another, and he never came back. These days, he’s completely out of shape, and I really hate to see it.I hate to see people fail at training. It's had such a big impact on my life, I’ve always wanted to help more people succeed at it, and change their life. But when I work as a personal trainer, I feel stuck, helping clients 1-on-1. Plus, it's just too expensive for most people. I had to find a better way.So, in 2016, I finished my PhD, I gathered a small team, and we started building this new technology. Our vision was to give you the ability to improve almost as fast as if you had trainer, but for much cheaper.With this technology, you apply all the latest science and the proven tricks of an experienced trainer automatically. Under the hood, your training is built around progressive overload (the fundamental principle we've just discussed). Your program updates in real time as you do it, so you always get in shape as fast as possible.Here's why you'll get in shape faster with Dr. Muscle...It's more advanced. Your program:
Starts at your level after a quick 1-time, 7-tap setup
Levels up with you, adding new exercises as you become more experienced, fitter, and stronger
Updates in real time as you work out with the best mix of reps, sets, and rest, so you always get in shape as fast as possible
Plus!It's more fun. As one early access customer put it: "It's like a surprise every workout".It's easy and fast. Your workout is ready at the push of a button. You'll save time.You'll never lose your data. Your workout data is backed up safely in the cloud, so even if you lose your phone, you'll never lose your progress. Simply log in, and you can resume where you left off.Exercise by exercise, workout by workout, Dr. Muscle can take you from the beginner stage to the advanced level. It automates almost everything, through the entire process. It guides you like a personal trainer, but it’s 10 times cheaper, always up to date, and available anytime, anywhere.Risks & challenges
We’ve been building this app for 2 years. To be honest, it wasn't easy. We started out with just 3 people, an idea, and little money. I wasn't sure the idea would stick. The main risk was spending all the money we could raise to build our prototype, just to see it fail.
But today, we’ve already fine tuned our prototype with data from 655 early access customers. We make enough money to keep the ball rolling, so we're here to stay. How much funding we get will influence how fast we implement our next features, so you don't risk backing this project and getting nothing in return. In fact, you'll get access to our prototype right away.
Building the right features is another challenge. My job is to make sure we build the features you want. My boss is you. To get your feedback, we've set up a special website. There, customers (like yourself?) get to suggest and vote for new features. We implement features with the most votes first, and we've already implemented 5 major features that way. So, we really value customer feedback. And when you become a customer, we will reach out and want to hear from you.
You can do this!Training changed my life. I've seen it change the lives of hundreds of people. And it could change your life, too. By giving you strength, discipline, energy, and confidence. But it's hard. That's why we've made Dr. Muscle as easy to use as possible. It automates almost everything. It guides you in real time, and motivates you to get in shape. It's available anytime, anywhere. We're making training a rewarding experience, simple, and fun again. Come get in shape and improve with us. It could change your life.

story:
IllumiBowl is back & better than ever! Since it was the amazing support of crowdfunding that helped us develop the world's very first toilet bowl night-light two years ago, we want you to be the among the first to receive the new & improved Illumibowl before anyone else; at a special Indiegogo price! 

 

 NEW ILLUMIBOWL FEATURES

IllumiBowl has been upgraded in EVERY way:

  • NEW: Never-Fall Arm (No more suction cups! Never falls off again!)
  • NEW: 3 Stage Dimmer (Set brightness to your preferred level)
  • NEW: Smooth Color Transitions 
  • NEW: Freeze on any color or transition (16 color combinations & unlimited shades)
  • NEW: Price: only $10 for Kickstarter Only! (Hello stocking stuffers!)
  • UPGRADED: Longer Battery Life (Lasts 4-6 months)
  • UPGRADED: Better Motion Sensor
  • UPGRADED: Body Materials & circuit board (Stronger & more reliable)
  • SAME: 100% lifetime guarantee!
  • SAME: Fits ANY toilet
  • SAME: Sets between any single color or auto-cycle at a touch
  • SAME: Water-resistant 
  • SAME: Dedicated team 

 

 

DEVELOPING the NEW ILLUMIBOWL

We were able to take all of our amazing customer's feedback over the last two years and significantly refine, redesign & reengineer the perfect IllumiBowl Toilet Night Light.

SWIMMING WITH THE SHARKS

Since our first successful Kickstarter campaign two years ago, we have since been featured on ABC's Shark Tank & made a deal with Kevin O'Leary! Kevin is an amazing partner and he has helped take IllumiBowl to new heights.

story:
All necessary funds have been raised and no more donations are needed! 

Thank you!  Thank you!  Thank you!

 

 5,500 - AOL Teacher Training Program

   500 - RT flight to North Carolina

   200 - Ground transportation costs

   200 - IndieGoGo/CC Processing Fees

(2,000) - External Scholarship

  (500) - Airline miles donated for flight

----

$3,900 Total Costs

 

 3,552 - Raised Online (as of June 4th)

    350 - Raised Offline (as of June 4th)

 ----

$3,902 Total Contributions

 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hello!


My name is LaShanda and in January of 2007, I was introducted to the power of deep breathing and meditation.  Since then, I have nurtured and developed a daily practice that has sparked unbelievable amounts of personal transformation and growth in my life, as well as given me power over my emotions and thoughts.

For the past 3 years, I've wanted to learn how to teach these same techniques to others, and I was recently accepted to the Art of Living teacher's training program in Boone, NC at the International Center for Peace and Well-Being.  Exciting! 

(Please visit my website for more details about me and pictures)

http://www.higherpurposehealing.com/fundraiser

 

My Inspiration...

In Boone, I will be learning how to teach youth and adults simple but powerful tools to handle stress, anxiety, negative emotions, and trauma.  I've seen it over and over again...when the nervous system is free from stress, people are able to smile again and all the human values we cherish -- love, joy, compassion, kindness, etc. bubble up to the surface.  I am inspired to give this experience to as many people as possible.

 

Benefits people experience in the courses I will be teaching after the training:

  • Reduce and manage stress
  • Develop leadership
  • Empower positive action
  • Serve their community
  • Connect to other people
  • Improve the quality of their own lives and the lives of others around them
  • Obtain peace of mind
  • Improve health and wellness

 

I Need Your Help!

As many of you know, I recently started my own consulting business related to detoxifying the mind, body, and spirit, using raw food and herbal botanicals. 

My financial situation is still challenging as I work towards building a business and client base in the Bay Area.  Any money that I spend on this training program will come from my savings which are going towards living expenses, while I start my new business, so fundraising will be necessary!


Please help me take this next step in my journey and make it to Boone!  Any contribution at any level would be much appreciated. 

 

No funds, but still want to help?

  • Share my fundraising page with friends using Facebook, Twitter, etc.; there are plenty of prizes that your friends might be interested in.
  • Consider donating your talents/service as a prize for a someone who contributes a certain level of money to the fundraiser; contact me to donate.
  • Send me positive energy and wish me well!

 

With Love and Gratitude,

LaShanda

story:
We are Paskay Org

Paskay is a Quechua word which means to free yourself physically and spiritually. The organization Paskay aims to help people to help themselves through providing education, training and work opportunities as well as health and nutrition initiatives.

For this year 2012, we would sincerely like to invite you and your organization to be part of the following project of Creating an Organic Garden to supply organic food to our school kitchens of Pachar and Rumira which is desperately needed for the severely deprived students of the Sacred Valley, Cusco.

The need for creating an Organic Garden:

Nowadays, markets are filled with food produced with chemicals such as strong insecticides, hormones and genetically modified seeds, hence we would like to produce and grow our food organically, reviving and preserving ancient knowledge of nature.

Our garden will use natural fertilizers such as manure from animals, especially from Cuy (Guinea Pigs), as well as natural insecticides such as plant extracts.

Here, we will facilitate workshops to teach the effective ancient techniques of organic food production. The workshops will emphasize the protection of Pachamama (Mother Earth) and the reforestation of indigenous plants for native animal shelter.

In this garden we will plant medicine herbs, so the teacher of Rumira who is a medicine man who studied natural medicine can teach the children how to make natural medicine from local plants.

 

In this Organic Garden, we intend to produce:

-          Organic cereals: Corn, Quinoa, Beans, Tarwi, Amaranth, Quichua, etc Quinoa and Quichua are both complete proteins and very easily assimilated by the human body

-          Tubers: Potato, Ullucos, Carrots, Beets, etc

-          Organic Cucurbits: Pumpkin, common Italian squash

-          Vegetables: Onions, Tomatoes, Cauliflower, Lettuce, Cabbage, Broccoli, Radishes, Peas, Celery, Spinach, Hot peppers, Garlic, Beets, Cucumber

-          Aromatic herbs: Chamomile, Fennel, Oregano, Coriander, Parsley, Lemon balm, Mint, Yerba Santa

-          Small fruit: Strawberries,

-          Organic Fruits: Avocado, Apples, Peaches, Cherries, Oranges, Pears, Lemons, Grapefruit, Passion fruit, Lucuma, Elderberry, Cherimoya.

 

Cost of creating the garden of 3000m2, $3,000.00

-          Purchase of materials and tools for the construction

-          Transportation

-           Food for workers and volunteers

-          Other expenses

 

Maintenance cost, $3,600.00 a year

-          Payment for the agronomist

-          Seeds

-          Expenses for the Workshops for school children

-          Other expenses

 

The way you can also be part of these project is to help us to circulate this letter and invite other people and organizations to join us.

 

*Heart Greetings to you and to those around you*

 

 

YOURS SINCERELY

PASKAY ORG

Email: paskay1@hotmail.com

Website: www.paskay.org

Cusco – Peru

story:
Our dear friend Michael Gray, AKA Papa, has been stricken with stage 4 colon cancer. Emergency surgery was performed to remove the tumor from his colon however, the cancer has spread to his lungs and liver. Michael has just started his first round of chemo and continues to have a positive attitude.

As a freelance stylist in the fashion industry, it is difficult to obtain certain benefits that full time employees may receive in other positions. We are hoping to help raise funds to assist with Michael's medical expenses and loss of income.

Michael is such a kind and generous soul who is always thoughtful and caring towards others. He is loved by many and this is why we call him Papa!

Please be one of Papa's Angels and give what you can;) Beautiful thoughts and prayers are also more than welcome.

With much love and gratitude!

xoxo

Papa's Angels

A note from Papa:

I would like to thank all of you for the outpouring of support. All of the kind words,prayers,cards,flowers and
contributions are truly appreciated.I feel so blessed to have you all in my life. Knowing that so many people care makes it easier for me to get through this trying time.
I would also like to thank my team of special angels.I would never have been able to get through this without
them.

I love you all so much!

love,
Papa

story:
FREE Software in Ghana Fall of 2012

I am going with Computer Reach to deploy 100 Edubutnu desktops in Ghana, Africa.
Please review my project notebook for specific details on where I am going and how much it costs me.

Computer Reach does not have the funding to pay me for my time or cover all of my expenses. Please give generously.

 

NOW is a pivital moment in Ghana

We are there at the invitation of Africa ICT Right to establish a relationship with the Ghanan government for Free Software in education. This Fall 2012 project marks the first visit to Ghana with the intention of returning every 6 months to deploy 100 more desktops and visit our deployments. Pending your funding, we will continue to deploy Free Software in Ghana and resolve the digital divide.


Additionally, Ghana is in the myst of a Presidential election. Therefore, it is critical that now Free Software gets highly visible positive exposure in Ghana, specifically, the sites that we will visit in the capital of Accra and the villages of Gama East, West Gonja, and Ho.

My Role with Free Software and Computer Reach 

I am working uncompensated full-time for the 501c3 non-profit Computer Reach as the "FREE Software Director." This role joins my interest resolving the digital divide and recycling with my experience in the Free Software Desktop. I am well qualified to deploy 100 desktops in Ghana Africa this Fall because:

  • Over 13 years of professional experience in working with GNU/Linux desktops with Pittsburgh Supercomputing, Carnegie Mellon University, TimeSys Corporation, Bettis Laboratory, and Wellspring Worldwide.
  • I was the engineering architect behind Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science's first Red Hat Linux computer lab.
  • Through my leadership in Western PA Linux User Group since 2010, I mentored Computer Reach's Executive Director, Dave Sevick, through the process of adding Edubuntu and Free Software offerings for Apple desktops.
  • I am a volunteer for Free Geek Chicago which refurbishes desktops with the Free Software Desktop, Xubuntu.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Even though this is a full time effort for me, Computer Reach does not have the funding to give me a salary or to reimburse all of my expenses. With the full cost of $250 for each computer, Computer Reach has wisely decided to put as much as their funds as possible into physical resources.

 

  • Every time I encounter an expense, I document it on my notebook.
  • Travel to an African nation for a US citizen means Visa expenses and immunization.
  • The flight to Accra, Ghana cost $1500 alone and that is at a price that is hard to beat.
  • If I don't reach my goal of $3000, my personal savings will be drained. This comes at a time which I do not have any other income or a "day job" to resume after the mission.

The Impact

Funding me generously means that I will proceed with confidence. Every six months, I will return to Ghana. Each time I will recruit, train, and manage yet another team of competent professionals in IT, education, and project management to deploy 100 more desktops.

Even though we are deploying 100 desktops, 1000s of lives will be touched as this is the only source of technology for their children and their families.

By using Free Software, we save money for Computer Reach and the program recipients by using non-proprietary software. This insures no surprise

We are giving the very best in software in education. I deployed Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science's first Free Software computer lab. This "FREE" software is the best for students because they have access to source code to study, build upon, and redistribute.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

All well-wishers are invited to participate, even if you cannot help with this campaign today.

  • Please help us get out the word through your social network.
  • The Computer Reach team will keep in constant contact regarding the status of Ghana via a mailing list. Sign up link coming soon.
  • There will be a bon-voyage party in Pittsburgh PA on October 8. RSVP here.
