story:
Hello, my name is Jean Nicol and I have been trying to support Robert Moldenhauer and his parents any way I can for the past 7 months. I am a very passionate autism advocate and my heart went out to this young man who had been refused the life saving treatment he needed by 8 hospitals, 2 in their home state of Wisconsin, USA. They could not provide dialysis for him because he is autistic. Their advice to let him die was not an option for Robert’s parents.

Robert has been receiving needed treatment at Boston Children’s for nearly 6 months. Now strong enough to have a kidney transplant, with a donor waiting, they begin a lengthy period of tests and preparation.

I am hoping by setting up this campaign to run briefly until Oct 17/12 we can raise $50,000 they will need to live in Boston for approx 1 year. Robert has made tremendous gains in the past 6 months with the marvelous care he has received at Boston Children’s. They will face huge medical bills one day as their health insurance with Physicians’ Insurance will not cover out of state care costs. But for now they just need our help so they can live in Boston to celebrate Robert’s good health when he gets his new kidney! Your contribution will help make this possible.

The Moldenhauers have been living at Yawkey House near the hospital, funded by donations that have run out and now they must leave there and find an apt. The minimum rent for a 1 bdrm apt near the hospital  is $2000 plus they have transportation costs when Robert’s father must return to work in WI every 2 weeks. They will need approx $50,000 over the next year to rent a 1 bdr apt near the hospital, transportation costs for when dad has to return to work in WI every 2 weeks and medical costs for medications, nutritional supplements and special renal dietary requirements.

$50,000 is a lot to raise in 2 weeks but I know it can be done and we need to do this. I have followed Robert’s struggle with challenges and his strength over the past 7 months. Robert has certainly displayed  a  will to live, we need to provide the means for him to do that!

Know that by contributing to this campaign you will help to save his life. What a wonderful opportunity that is!

If we don’t make it to $50,000 by Oct 17 we will have what we raise minus 9% in fees. Let’s work together to not lose that 9%.

I was originally drawn to know about Robert because he is autistic and it is my passion to do what I can for children and families living with autism. I have come to know Robert’s family well over the past 7 months and still want to help for these reasons but now because I look at the health challenges he has had since birth and the strength he has had to overcome them.  I want to help him to again be able to live a healthy life but I can’t do this alone, I need the help of many who will donate to this campaign. The Cardiologist says his heart is very strong again, with the good medical care he has had the past 5 months at Boston Children’s, and should last a lifetime. This is the transplanted heart he received shortly after birth!

If at this time you find you are unable to contribute financially there are other ways you can help by sharing this story with others and helping us get more donations. Use available indiegogo share tools.

To be in touch with what has been happening to Robert the past 14 years go to http://www.robertomid.com/  and to  https://www.facebook.com/savesunshine  an active group that supports this family following day to day updates on Robert’s challenges and successes. Please join us there. Please help in any way you can.

story:
What the heck is a Filter Friend?

Filter Friend is an original invention from wounded veteran Robert Walker Jr. His invention makes it possible for everyone — especially those with disabilities — to accomplish a potentially dangerous activity in a safe and efficient manner. Constructed of sturdy aluminum and plastic with an adjustable head, Filter Friend attaches to a pole that puts ceiling-mounted air filters well within reach. You can then feel free to use Filter Friend’s convenient teeth to open the grate and latch onto the unwanted filter — no ladders required.


What We Need and What You Get

Filter Friend is already designed and patented. What we need is $50,000 in order to fund marketing and tooling for our product to reach consumers. What if we don't reach our goal? The funds we do earn will go towards a licensing agreement.

In return for your contribution, you will receive a variety of perks (listed below) including but not limited to a special thank you, “Every Filter Needs A Friend” merchandise, bumper stickers and even your very own Filter Friend.

Bumper sticker:

Tshirt:


The Impact

Filter Friend helps create a safer, cleaner home environment. Filter Friend allows you to change your air filter without a dangerous ladder, spurring you to replace your filter more regularly. What's more, the air in your home will be fresher and cleaner, likely alleviating any allergies and unwanted particulates. No ladders, no pain, no problem.


Risks and Challenges

As we have said, Filter Friend is already a tangible, patented product. All we need is to reach our funding goal in order to reach market. That is our biggest challenge.

In order to overcome this bottleneck, we're implementing a rigorous social media campaign in order to get the word out about our unique product. You can help us by sharing Filter Friend on your own social media feeds and by word of mouth.


Short on cash? Not a problem.

We understand that not every person is able to make a monetary contribution, but you can still help! Remember:

  • Help get the word out in any way you can! Facebook, Twitter, word of mouth, carrier pigeon, whatever!

  • Sharing is as simple as hitting the share buttons at the top of our IndieGoGo page!

You can access logos, product photos, and promotional images through this link.
story_txt:
What the heck is a Filter Friend?Filter Friend is an original invention from wounded veteran Robert Walker Jr. His invention makes it possible for everyone — especially those with disabilities — to accomplish a potentially dangerous activity in a safe and efficient manner. Constructed of sturdy aluminum and plastic with an adjustable head, Filter Friend attaches to a pole that puts ceiling-mounted air filters well within reach. You can then feel free to use Filter Friend’s convenient teeth to open the grate and latch onto the unwanted filter — no ladders required.What We Need and What You GetFilter Friend is already designed and patented. What we need is $50,000 in order to fund marketing and tooling for our product to reach consumers. What if we don't reach our goal? The funds we do earn will go towards a licensing agreement.In return for your contribution, you will receive a variety of perks (listed below) including but not limited to a special thank you, “Every Filter Needs A Friend” merchandise, bumper stickers and even your very own Filter Friend.Bumper sticker:Tshirt:The ImpactFilter Friend helps create a safer, cleaner home environment. Filter Friend allows you to change your air filter without a dangerous ladder, spurring you to replace your filter more regularly. What's more, the air in your home will be fresher and cleaner, likely alleviating any allergies and unwanted particulates. No ladders, no pain, no problem.Risks and ChallengesAs we have said, Filter Friend is already a tangible, patented product. All we need is to reach our funding goal in order to reach market. That is our biggest challenge.In order to overcome this bottleneck, we're implementing a rigorous social media campaign in order to get the word out about our unique product. You can help us by sharing Filter Friend on your own social media feeds and by word of mouth. Short on cash? Not a problem.We understand that not every person is able to make a monetary contribution, but you can still help! Remember:
Help get the word out in any way you can! Facebook, Twitter, word of mouth, carrier pigeon, whatever!
Sharing is as simple as hitting the share buttons at the top of our IndieGoGo page!
You can access logos, product photos, and promotional images through this link.

story:
Watch our "Call To Action" video to learn more about how you can be involved with LifeAbove.

DID YOU KNOW...

That after the wake of terror from the earthquake in Haiti, airlines suspended their travel to and from Haiti from January 12th until February 19th. For over a month, people suffered and the only air travel in and out of Haiti were business/cargo aircraft. LifeAbove's mission will help end the suffering...

LifeAbove Mission

LifeAbove is a nonprofit Christian organization committed to providing rehabilitation to God's children that have sustained injuries or disabilities as a result from a natural disaster event. LifeAbove is a ministry from Life Church based out of Bloomington MN.

  • Deployment Ready: LifeAbove teams plan on being deployment ready, travel arranged and on scene with an assignment confirmed by our host country to reduce response times for victims.
  • Critical Phase Response: Identify people post-trauma care to start rehabilitation to minimize future functional impairment and disability.
  • Mobilize Phase Support: Develop and initiate rehabilitation programs that focus on mobilizing victims to become self reliant/producing for their family and community.
  • Infrastructure Development: Initiate long term educational/community based rehabilitation programs with communities for persons with disabilities.

LifeAbove purpose is to show Christ love through aviation, medicine and counseling by providing humanitarian aid to areas affected by natural disasters and/or have a lack of rehabilitative resources.

TOGETHER WE CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE TODAY!

www.LifeAbove.org

What will the money be used for...

Aviation

Our Volunteer Airline Pilots are trained in the most advanded aircraft in the world. Everyday they are responsible for thousands of travelers to get to their destinations. There are many situations in normal operations such as weather, other traffic and terrain that a pilot must be equipped with the best techonlogy available to ensure the safety of flight. With the added element of navigating to remote areas after sustaining a natural disaster not only requires the well trained pilots, but also the proper equipement needed for the safety of the passengers. It is for these reasons that the Volunteer Airline Pilots choose the Challenger 604 to complete this mission. It is the aircraft that we are most familiar with and feel the safest completing the mission of LifeAbove ministry worldwide.  

  • Instead of purchasing an $12,000,000 aircraft, it is in our best interest based on the amount of hours we operate (approx 100) the aircraft to lease.
  • Monthly lease = $45,000.00 per month
  • Hourly Cost =$600.00 per hour (Engines & Maintenance Reserve)
  • Hanger Rental = $15,000.00 per year
  • Insurance = $45,000.00
  • Fuel = $179,000 per year (based on Fuel burn @ 100 hours per year)
The above figures are estimates and most accurately reflect the current market. As you know, the market can change in any moment. LifeAbove is prepared to make those adjustments. 

Medical Rehabilitation

One key aspect of LifeAbove's mission is providing medical rehabilitation to the victims and responders of a natural diaster. Although, many foreign aid respond to natural disasters to help and give medical care to the victims in response to saving lives, rehabilitation services are severly lacking. Most foreign countries have few health resources let alone rehabilitation services and the poorly developed infrastructure before a natural disaster causes even greater burden on the existing health system and community. Because aid is short lived, victims suffering from disabilities or impairments suffer long tem effects without the continuation of care and progression of rehabilitation. 

LifeAbove will provide medical rehabilitation specifically through the chiropractic profession. The Chiropractic philosophy is concerned with human health and disease process. Chiropractic pays attention to the whole human body through physiological and biomechanical aspects including structual, spinal, musculoskeletal, neurological, vascular, nutritional, emotional and environmental relationships.

LifeAbove also provides Crisis Counseling services are an integral part of providing necessary support for victims who have experienced a traumatic event.  Scripture indicates that the whole person is comprised of the body, mind, and soul. It speaks of how our bodies are the temple of God.  It speaks of renewing our mind and having the mind of Christ. And it speaks of how people have a living soul.

For medical supplies need for each doctor on the mission, we estimate the Average Cost Per Mission = $7036.40

LifeAbove want to commit to 6 scheduled trips per year to areas that have sustained a natural disaster and/or lack rehabilitative services. In addition, 3 trips will be in response to natural disaster incidents bringing our total trip per year to be 9. 

With more funding, we can make more trips. But we need you to make this happen. Donate to our mission to help save thousands of disabled suffering children. With your donations, they will feel the LOVE OF OUR LORD AND SAVIOR JESUS CHRIST. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
  • Spread the word and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! And Make Our Voice Heard Through You!

story:
I'll make this short; no sob story, just the fact that summer is coming, and I live in a ridiculously old building. There's no air conditioning, so I really want to be able raise money for an A/C window unit. Last summer was stupidly hot, and I was only barely able to buy a window unit, and that was when summer was almost over. Now that I've moved into a slightly bigger place, it's going to take more than that to cool it off. 

So, for the first time in a long while, I'm giving away skype shows for the truly generous! :P 

Please help in any way you can! Every a dollar helps. c:

 

 

 

($500 is the minimum amount I can choose, but it will be put to good use, I promise you! ♥)

story:
Short Summary

20fold world record holder Wim Hof (the Iceman) has developed a method that enables humans to positively influence their auto immune system and fight a number of related diseases in 3 simple steps. Gradual exposure to the cold, breathing exercises and focus of the mind. Anyone can learn these skills in only a few days. 

On the 24th of january 2014, a team of 25 healthy and ill people, guided by ’the Iceman’ Wim Hof, will set off for Tanzania to climb the Kilimanjaro (5890m), accompanied by a medical research team from the prestigious UMC Radbout university Nijmegen. Amongst the climbers are people with Cancer, Rheumatism, Asthma, Crohn’s disease, and Multiple Sclerosis. They will climb the Kilimanjaro shirtless, wearing only shorts and shoes in only 3 days (usually takes 6).

Why? To show that it is possible for humans to transcend themselves, their diseases and to directly influence their autonomous nervous system and hence the auto immune system. The challenge is threefoold. First there is the extreme cold at the top (up to minus 20 degrees celcius / xx degrees fahrenheit). Then there is the physical challenge of ascending 4500 meters on a 35km route in just 3 days. But the biggest challenge is the danger of altitude disease. It is not unusual for an ascend in altitude this fast that less than 40% of the attendees reach the summit. Above 4000 m there is only 60 % of oxygen in the air. By applying the special breathing techniques and extreme focus, the teammembers will influence their auto immunesystem and rapidly increase the count of red bloodcells in their blood, which is required to cope with the shortage of oxigen which causes altitude disease (which can be deadly).

By exposing his body to extreme circumstances in nature for over 35 years, Wim Hof discovered a method which any human being can learn in just a few days. It allows for control over his or her autonomic nervous system (something science claims to be impossible). In turn, this control allows people to activate the self-healing capacities of the body and thereby positively help the body fight against diseases. We need further scientific research to gather official proof for the excelent results we are already seeing amongst the teammembers for this expedition.

Absolute astonishment about the capacity of our body. Is that simple for us to affect our immune system? Step by step our skeptical view changed into amazement. How far can one reach with the Wim Hof Method (WHM)? Imagine how ill people could influence their health and how healthy people could become so much fitter, stronger and more energetic. The medical researchers have been chained to these questions since they connected to the Wim Hof Method and their current main purpose has become to collect hard scientific evidence to change the worldwide belief about true human potential with the right mind/body connection. It is therefore that medical professors all over the world are interested in the results Wim Hof has achieved. Wim holds over 20 world records, mostly related to challenging and surviving the extreme cold.

What We Need & What Do You Get

We will apply the funds from this campaign to cover the expenses for the scientific medical staff and equipment that is required to scientifically record all medical data of teammembers. Any additional funds would be used to cover for additional expenses made by the team as a whole.

The Impact

In order to convince medical staff and common laymen around the world of the amazing and powefull results of the simple but effective Wim Hof method, we need more scientific evidence. The Kilimanjaro climb is one of the events we are organising to gather this evidence. During the Kilimanjaro trip we will use the extreme circumstances as our reference; the goal is to show how the method could also be added to combat against auto-imune diseases. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you as thrilled as we are? Help us spread the word! 

OR donate directly

to the Wim Hof Foundation: IBAN: NL68INGB0006589267. Thank you for your support!



27 November training session - Poland Mount Snitzka (1602 m) -15 degrees.

Wim Hof - a man with a mission. One heart One group.

story:
On April 19, 2014, Jessie Jeanne Stinnett completed her RYT (Registered Yoga Teacher) 200 hr certification and was offered an apprenticeship by STRETCH one of London's hottest yoga studios.

This unique opportunity awards one newly certified teacher per year the ability to spend one month in an intensive training situation. Jessie will dedicate herself entirely to practicing her newly acquired teaching skills, honing in on the subtleties of the yoga asanas, setting her apart from multitudes of green teachers who must refine their skills slowly over time.

For one month STRETCH  will provide Jessie with

  • housing
  • room and board
  • hands-on teaching experience
  • personal guidance from the Directors
  • comprehensive managerial training on running a successful yoga studio

Jessie seeks $2000 to purchase one round trip plane ticket from New York to London in order to accept the apprenticeship.

Upon completion of the apprenticeship, Jessie will return to the US ready to dive into teaching yoga at a profound level, providing clients with a deeply enriching yogic experience - bringing her one step closer to her dream of opening a yoga/arts center with a resident dance company.

STRETCH is owned and co-directed by Carl Faure & Sophie Whippy, both registered Yoga Alliance UK instructors through Frog Lotus Yoga International, lead by Vidya Jacqueline Heisel. Carl recently completed his RYT 500 certification with Vidya and continues to assistant teach Frog Lotus Teacher Trainings all over the world. 

If financial donation isn’t within your current means, helping spread the word is an equally appreciated contribution! Thanks so much for your time and support.
Love and light,
Jessie

More information on Frog Lotus International: http://www.froglotusyoga.com

More information on Stretch: http://www.stretchlondon.org

story:
Mike just found out that surgery is not an option for his torn Patellar tendon.  The treatment that he needs is over 1000 dollars and is not covered by insurance. 

Mike has put every penny into the gym and doesn't have a lot of wiggle room with funds to make treatment happen.   Also, if you are a member a happy Mike is much better than the miserable pissed off Mike we have seen lately. 

What We Need & What You Get

Please contribute whatever you can to help Mike repair his knee and continue his powerlifting career. 
  • Donations of $25 dollars will give you 2 weeks of unlimited classes to try at our gym
  • Donation of $50 or more get a Revolution Training Shirt and the option to get "open gym" for 2 weeks. 

I know there are a lot of causes out there and helping a guy squat 600 pounds may not sound like the most important goal with all that's going on.  But if Mike has helped you in training or online with programming which I know he does a lot of, be generous and help him out.

story:
What is NoGlo?

My name is Spencer Gordon. I began working on NoGlo while research metabolism at UC Berkeley. Two very close friends of mine had Alcohol Flush Reaction (AFR) and were complaining about a lack of solutions. I started to do some research and soon found out about the serious health risks associated with AFR (those with it are at significantly increased risk of gastric and esophageal cancer, liver cirrhosis, and even Alzheimer's Disease). Not just was this a cosmetic problem, or an immediate problem, but a very important medical and health issue, that not many are aware of. I spent the next two years obsessing, researching, formulating, and testing the NoGlo product based on the specific disorder.

AFR is caused by a genetic mutation which leads to a deficiency in breaking down a compound called acetaldehyde, a known carcinogen that is 30-times as toxic as alcohol. Acetaldehyde is created from alcohol when you drink it. Since those with AFR cannot break it down properly, it accumulates to extreme levels in the blood, causing dizziness, nausea, headache, increased heart rate and body temperature, and intense red facial flushing. Additionally it leads to the oxidative damage that may lead to the long-term health issues described above. NoGlo is designed to reduce the accumulation of acetaldehyde.

We recently completed an internal-placebo controlled, human clinical trial for the NoGlo product in Los Angeles, CA. All subjects in the study had AFR. The trial demonstrated a reduction in the symptoms of dizziness, nausea, lightheadedness, overheating, and physical discomfort. More importantly however, NoGlo significantly reduced the blood acetaldehyde levels that lead to the symptoms and damage. 

NoGlo is an encapsulated formula designed to be taken daily for best effect, or 1 hour before you drink. NoGlo can really help people. We have researched it, developed it, and tested it and it is time to get it out to the people who should really know about it!


What we need to spread NoGlo and AFR awareness, and what you will receive for helping our cause! 

Our goals are to spread awareness about Alcohol Flush Reaction as a serious problem beyond just turning red, and to spread awareness about the NoGlo product, which can positively impact the lives and health of those with AFE. 

We are asking for funds so that we can continue the development of the NoGlo product, and spread the word about NoGlo to those it will benefit. It takes a lot to spread a message, even if it is something great. 

In return we will give you what we make... NoGlo! Even if you don't have Alcohol Flush Reaction (AFR), NoGlo is a potent anti-hangover product, because the same compound that causes the redness and all the damage and symptoms of AFR, is the same compound that leads to hangovers in any drinker! This compound is called acetaldehyde, and reducing its accumulation is what NoGlo demonstrated in our recent clinical study. It is also filled with some of the strongest anti-oxidants known to promote general health. All ingredients are recognized and established as safe by the US FDA.

Our Impact

AFR is a problem that affects approximately 1 billion people globally, and 40% of all people of Chinese, Japanese, and Korean descent. It is an enormous unmet need with real health implication. Your contribution will help us not only spread a product that will help, but also spread knowledge. A huge hurdle in tackling AFR is education, because many who have it are not aware of the health risks and should be drinking responsibly and moderately if they are going to drink. The more people know, the more we can make lifestyle decisions with our health in mind.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just spread the word! Tell those you know, share on Facebook, or use Indiegogo's share tool!

This compound is called acetaldehyde, and reducing its accumulation is what NoGlo demonstrated in our recent clinical study. It is also filled with some of the strongest anti-oxidants known to promote general health. All ingredients are recognized and established as safe by the US FDA.Our ImpactAFR is a problem that affects approximately 1 billion people globally, and 40% of all people of Chinese, Japanese, and Korean descent. It is an enormous unmet need with real health implication. Your contribution will help us not only spread a product that will help, but also spread knowledge. A huge hurdle in tackling AFR is education, because many who have it are not aware of the health risks and should be drinking responsibly and moderately if they are going to drink. The more people know, the more we can make lifestyle decisions with our health in mind.Other Ways You Can HelpJust spread the word! Tell those you know, share on Facebook, or use Indiegogo's share tool!

story:
I am a 20 year old college student living in a small town in Pennsylvania. I was born in Iowa and have had a lot of family issues that have caused me to end up where I am now. 


My mother has lived in Iowa for most of her life, she doesn't have much of anything and has also made some bad choices in her life that has led her to where she is now. 
She has health problems that make getting a job and supporting herself even more difficult than it was years ago.
She has blessed me with so much love in my life that I feel that it is my job to do everything I can to help her afford something so important such as food.
I don't believe that anyone should have to wonder where their next meal is going to come from, and I am determined to help out my loving mother in a time of extreme need.

By making a donation, you are helping me support my mom from over a thousand miles away! 


Thank you so much!

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for taking time to view this campaign. We are the family of Fidelina Rodriguez who is an amazing mother of 3 and grandmother who puts god first and everyone before herself. She was on a trip to Nicaragua when she got very ill very fast and ended up in the intensive care unit with bacterial pneumonia, and meningitis. She is now fighting for her life, and they will not allow her to get on any flight, the only way is air ambulance which is expensive .

En Español.

Resumen corto

Gracias por tomarse el tiempo para ver esta campaña . Somos la familia de Fidelina Rodríguez, que es una increíble madre de 3 y abuela que pone a Dios primero y todo el mundo antes de que ella misma. Ella estaba en un viaje a Nicaragua cuando ella se puso muy enferma muy rápido y terminó en la unidad de cuidados intensivos por neumonía bacteriana y meningitis. Ella ahora está luchando por su vida, y no le permitieron montarse en el  vuelo a EEUU, el único camino es la ambulancia aérea que es caro.

What We Need & What You Get


 -The funding needed will help cover the cost of the emergency airlift from Managua to Miami . Her condition is critical and she cannot take regular flights 

-Helping our cause you will receive a personalized thank you card written by her grandchildren 

- Any amount you can donate will help even $1

En Español.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

-La financiación necesaria ayudará a cubrir el costo del puente aéreo de emergencia de Managua a Miami. Su estado es crítico y que no puede tomar vuelos regulares 

-Ayudar a nuestra causa, usted recibirá un trato personalizado de gracias a la tarjeta escrita por sus nietos 

- Cualquier cantidad que usted puede donar ayudará incluso $ 1


The Impact

 - As a contributor you will be helping to save the life of a very kind and generous woman, and helping her family in this horrific event

El Impacto 

- Como contribuyente se le ayuda a salvar la vida de una mujer muy amable y generoso, y ayudar a su familia en este terrible evento

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can make a donation, but every one can still help share this campaign to help fidelina's chances.

all it takes is a click of the button please share...


Otras maneras de ayudar

No todo el mundo puede hacer una donación, sino que cada uno todavía puede ayudar a compartir esta campaña para ayudar a las posibilidades de Fidelina. 

todo lo que necesitas es un clic del botón, por favor comparta ...

story:
The Global Water Crisis + YOU!

The global water crisis is in an unprecedented state. Around the globe, 3.6 million people die each year from water-related illness and disease and the majority of those are children under the age of five. These deaths are largely preventable. Hundreds of millions of people are already boiling their water each day to make it safe to drink--Safi Water Works believes that there is a better way. 

YOU can help us begin to change those statistics with your support of our campaign to launch a Safi Water Works pilot in East Africa!

With your support, Safi Water Works will partner with globalbike, to pilot our human-powered water purification treatment units in East Africa. We will focus our efforts on providing jobs for women and girls as part of this first pilot initiative.

Safi Water Works has developed a human-powered product--powered by bicycle--that uses the proven technology of ultraviolet (UV) disinfection to kill water-borne pathogens, resulting in drinking water that is safe for consumption. 

We pair this technology with an entrepreneurial business model that creates micro-franchise opportunities for developing world entrepreneurs to earn a living wage, support themselves and their families, and achieve better health in their communities.

Through strong partnerships with nonprofits, such as globalbike, we recruit, train and provide ongoing support to local entrepreneurs to Safi Water Works vendors. Micro-finance partners enable Safi entrepreneurs to receive a low-interest loan to make a down payment on their water business.

Each day, the entrepreneur connects directly to a community tap stand to serve neighbors. Pedaling the bike for one minute provides enough power to deliver 20 liters of clean drinking water, saving time, money, and natural resources. Each Safi entrepreneur can serve 100-150 households each day!

Our focus is on urban areas in the developing world, where populations are expected to grow significantly by 2050 and where already appropriate infrastructure to provide safe drinking water is lacking.

Safi Water Works makes safe, clean drinking water as simple as pedaling a bike!


What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise $27,500 to support launching a pilot in one city in East Africa. Any additional funds beyond our goal will enable us to build additional treatment units and support additional entrepreneurs, expanding the reach of the pilot and providing more clean water to communities:

Bicycle + Testing of TEN (10) Treatment Units: $15,000

Education + Outreach + Training in E. Africa: $5,000

Shipping to E. Africa: $2,500

Travel Costs: $5,000

BUT, the more we raise, the more entrepreneurs we can recruit to participate in the pilot! If we raise significantly more than our goal, we will launch a second pilot in another developing world city!

In return for your generous contribution to our pilot campaign, we are offering several items that will allow you to identify yourself as an early supporter of the Safi Water Works/globalbike partnership to bring clean water and income-generating opportunities to those most in need. Note: We will be following up with you for any items requiring a size or color choice.

Safi's First Human-Powered Prototype: Hand-Cranked UV Disinfection


Inspiration for the Safi Pedal-Powered Prototype (Kampala, Uganda):


Current Safi Pedal-Powered Prototype:


The Impact of Clean Drinking Water

Consider this:

  • 50% of the planet lives in urban areas 
  • Urban populations in the developing world will add an additional 2.9 billion people by 2050
  • Poor cities already cannot provide safe drinking water now

If you have ever traveled or lived in the developing world, you are likely aware that we have a global water crisis. And, this water crisis is not only an issue of scarcity, but also of access. According to the United Nations, more people in the world own cell phones than have access to a toilet.

Municipal systems cannot reliably provide safe drinking water, forcing customers to treat their water to ensure its safety, most often by boiling. As cities and slums grow at increasing rates, the situation worsens. Every day, lack of access to safe drinking water and sanitation kills thousands, leaving others with reduced quality of life.

The need for efficient, effective, convenient and affordable products is massive and it needs to happen now--and YOU can help!


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word about Safi Water Works and our pilot campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools.

Like us on Facebook.

Follow us on Twitter.

Follow us on LinkedIn.


More About Safi Water Works:

Safi Water Works is a mission-driven corporation created in direct response to the global water crisis affecting hundred of millions of people every day. We are putting safe, effective, simple solutions into the hands of the people who need them the most.

Launched in Portland, Oregon in early 2013, the Safi Water Works team brings together experience that spans across four decades. We have successfully launched for-profit and nonprofit businesses. From water systems engineering to product development to marketing, management and fundraising, our team has the right formula for success. 

Read about Safi:

Huffington Post

Business Insider

Portland Business Journal


More About globalbike:

globalbike is a nonprofit organization that uses the transformative power of bikes to connect women and girls in Tanzania with the life-saving resources they need to prosper. globalbike currently has chapters in South Carolina, North Carolina, and Georgia.

story:
My name is Marjan van Mourik

and I founded PAZ-Holandesa in 2000 and our aim is to improve the circumstances of socially and economically disadvantaged Peruvian children by offering free medical care, in the broadest sense of the word.

Since april 2012 we have our own children's hospital in Arequipa and in this hospital we're attending for three months at Roger (13 years) and Roxi (11 years).
Both are victims of a terrible accident caused by a cable high voltage electricity in the province of Puno. Roger lost his right arm and a part of his genitals and  Roxi lost both forearms, trough the electric burns.

In these three months, they have not only gotten intensive medical care but also psychological therapy so that they can accept their dramatically changed lives.

Now they need armprotheses!

Now they need armprotheses so both can have again an independent life and go back to their families and villages.

These armprotheses cost per piece 1500 euro/1700 dollar and we need to buy three to get these kids back on track.

story:
The Problem

The United States produces approximately 6 million tons of medical waste each year.  Much of this is equipment and supplies that are still in usable condition.

At the same time, Cameroon suffers some of the worst supported health care on earth.  Cameroon was ranked number 164 out of 190 countries considered by the World Health Organization.  The Cameroonian government spends only 0.9% of its GDP on health, contrary to the World Health Organization’s recommended minimum of 4%.  With 48% of the population living below the poverty line, this leaves a burden for health payments the Cameroonian people cannot afford to bear: 80% of the population cannot afford even basic health care. 

Our Mission

SHARE is dedicated to promoting sustainable healthcare through the recycling of used medical equipment from the US for use in Cameroon.  SHARE aims to bridge the disconnect between the excess of recycled equipment in the United States and the need for equipment in Cameroonian hospitals.

The basis of SHARE can be summarized by 4 Cs: Contact, Collect, Consign, and Coach. Contact hospitals in the developing nations that are in dire need of supplies and equipment, collect the medical supplies, consign the needed supplies to developing nations (starting in Cameroon), and coach the physicians on proper care and use of equipment. Our focus is not only to provide support in the initial stages with medical supplies and extensive internal training, but also to foster the hospitals abroad to become self-sufficient without us in the long-run.

The Impact

Your contribution will make a real and lasting impact.  Our pilot partner hospital is one of only two mental health hospitals serving the entire Cameroonian population of 20 million people. The hospital also has pulmonary and HIV/AIDS divisions, and the staff is dedicated and passionate about their patients.  However, there is a severe lack of equipment, particularly beds.  Your contribution will help us ship beds and other equipment to this hospital, transforming the lives of the patients there.

Our Vision

SHARE is unique in that we are training and providing long-term support to develop hospital autonomy. In addition, our final goal is to differentiate SHARE from other organizations by creating enduring connections between hospitals in the United States and Cameroon.  To do so, we plan to implement a “Sister Hospital” program, as well as to create an online database to improve the connection between suppliers of equipment in the United States and seekers of equipment abroad.

Within one year's time following the first shipment, SHARE will collaborate with the partner hospital to create a statistical analysis of the impact of the equipment, which will involve both qualitative and quantitative studies.  

 

Our vision is for a world in which Cameroonian hospitals can function to their full potential, and provide their patients with the care they deserve. 

Please join us in our efforts! Every little bit counts.

story: There is an organization in Bangladesh called Light Bangladesh. They take girls from brothels with their mothers consent and save them from prostitution. Light Bangladesh provides the girls with a home, an education, and helps them grow and mature into amazing and unstoppable women!  They also offer to teach sex workers a skill so that they can start a new career.  We are going to serve the family that runs it and the girls inside the home to teach English and bring art and creativity from our home to theirs.  The cost of the trip per person is $3000 and there are six of us going, but every little bit helps.  Thank you for helping us bring light into the world of human trafficking!

story:
The Zion Medical Community Clinic was built by HELP International volunteers in the summer of 2012 and is located in the remote mountain village of Bunabuyoka, near Mbale, Uganda. The clinic was built in response to the need for accessible, quality healthcare in Bunabuyoka and the surrounding areas. This village has a population of 3,000 people, and the only way to access the community is by hiking a steep mountain. 

In this remote, mountaintop village:

  • The closest medical clinic is three kilometers away and separated by a
  • treacherous hike up a mountain, which cannot be done when a patient is very ill.
  • The nearest hospital is three hours away, and can only be reached by foot.
  • There are 1,950 children, under the age of 15, who do not have access to child immunizations or even the most basic care.
  • People die each year from preventable illnesses, like diarrhea.
  • Mothers deliver their own babies with only a razor blade to cut the umbilical cord.

Construction of the health clinic was a joint effort between HELP volunteers and the members of the village. For the first time, the people of Bunabuyoka now have access to a doctor and are able to receive life-saving care at the Zion Medical Community Clinic! The clinic officially opened on February 6, 2013, holding clinic days on Tuesdays and Wednesdays each week. It is operating very successfully and is providing quality healthcare and health education in a very efficient and effective manner. And the waiting room is always full! People come from villages all over the mountain to receive treatment at the Zion Clinic. On average, the clinic treats about 100 patients each week. The clinic also provides health education to the community through a team of 20 trained community health educators.

Despite these successes, ZMCC is currently facing great financial challenges. Through a cost-sharing program, patients pay a small fee for services and medication to help fund the clinic’s operational costs. However, residents of this village struggle to meet basic needs—daily meals, clean water and adequate housing. Patients are only able to pay 2,000 Ugandan Shillings, about $0.80, per visit, which does not cover the full operating costs of the clinic. In addition, the recent loss of a large grant that had been promised to ZMCC has left the clinic operating off of little to no funds, and it is often in debt to multiple sources. The amazing staff at ZMCC has been very understanding, and in the past 5 months, they have only been paid 2 months salary. Each week, administrators scramble to try to find money to pay for the staff’s food and transport and money to keep the clinic stocked with essential medications, but the clinic will not be able to operate much longer under these circumstances.

Plans are being put in place for the future financial sustainability of the clinic, but none of these can provide funding to ZMCC in the immediate future. Therefore, we are launching this fundraiser with the goal of raising one year of operational costs for the clinic. This will allow the clinic to function more normally and without the daily financial stress while the clinic’s administrators work on securing more funding and further developing sustainability plans for the future. Your contribution allows the Zion Medical Community Clinic to continue operating and providing quality healthcare to a community in need!

 

All sizes of donations are appreciated and needed! Click the link below to see ZMCC's annual itemized budget and to select something that you would be willing to donate--Nurse Peter's salary for a month, microscope slides for 6 months, a year's supply of Ibuprofen, etc. No donation is too small because all of these items are needed! You have the chance to help ZMCC continue providing healthcare and treatment to the wonderful people of the Bunabuyoka mountain villages! 

 

ZMCC Annual Budget 

 

When you make your donation, please make note of which item you are funding. Any unspecified donations will just be applied to the highest priority items! THANK YOU!!

Plans are being put in place for the future financial sustainability of the clinic, but none of these can provide funding to ZMCC in the immediate future. Therefore, we are launching this fundraiser with the goal of raising one year of operational costs for the clinic. This will allow the clinic to function more normally and without the daily financial stress while the clinic’s administrators work on securing more funding and further developing sustainability plans for the future. Your contribution allows the Zion Medical Community Clinic to continue operating and providing quality healthcare to a community in need!
 
All sizes of donations are appreciated and needed! Click the link below to see ZMCC's annual itemized budget and to select something that you would be willing to donate--Nurse Peter's salary for a month, microscope slides for 6 months, a year's supply of Ibuprofen, etc. No donation is too small because all of these items are needed! You have the chance to help ZMCC continue providing healthcare and treatment to the wonderful people of the Bunabuyoka mountain villages! 
 
ZMCC Annual Budget 
 
When you make your donation, please make note of which item you are funding. Any unspecified donations will just be applied to the highest priority items! THANK YOU!!

story:
The NCHC

Who We Are: Nicaragua Community Health Connection (NCHC) is a collaboration between Comunidad Connect and Emory University's Social Enterprise @ Goizueta after more than ten years of working closely with the community of Los Robles. NCHC's mission is to establish the first available health clinic for this hardworking community!

How We Work: Los Robles residents contribute their time and effort to various community health initiatives throughout the year. Each hour of community service logged by a Los Robles resident transfers US$2 in donations (from people like you!) to fund the construction and ongoing operation of their local health clinic. In this sustainable way, residents invest time and energy towards improving community health outcomes, while enabling funds raised by NCHC donors to cover clinical operations and maintenance, salaries for our full-time clinic staff, and for ongoing community service initiatives.​

For more info: NCHC Website

The Campaign

The Team: We are 6 students studying Social Enterprise at Emory University’s Goizueta Business School. In our Social Enterprise in Nicaragua class we learned of the hardships affecting the small coffee town of Los Robles and we immediately wanted to help. 

The Updated Goal: Our new goal is to raise $3000 or more in order to provide the medical clinic with basic supplies that will allow the nurse to sufficiently operate the clinic in Nicaragua, supplies such as thermometers, tongue depressors, wound cleanser, towels, and bandages. We are so grateful to have already met our initial goal, but we're excited about the possibility to help the clinic more than we could have ever imagined. 

The Reason: Raising money to provide a salaried medical staff and a stocked health clinic to Los Robles would help provide basic healthcare to the members of the community and promote wellness initiatives. Currently, the capital for the infrastructure of the clinic has been raised and the physical clinic has been built, however, to successfully help the community, we need to raise money to stock the building with the necessary materials. 

The Trip: On May 9th, we will be heading down to Nicaragua to experience the culture as well as to visit Los Robles to see the clinic firsthand. As a result of both your and our contributions, we will be arriving to a fully stocked health clinic.

The Incentives

If you donate one of the following amounts, you will receive:

Five Dollars: We will email you an album of pictures from our trip (of the clinic - of course) that you are contributing to!

Twenty-Five Dollars: A hand-crafted basket woven out of pine needles by women's cooperative we will visit in Nicaragua.

Fifty Dollars: A bag of Farmers to 40 coffee, a high quality coffee that promises to pay farmers in Nicaragua who grow the beans 40% of the purchase price (way more than fair trade pays).

Two-Hundred & Fifty Dollars: An authentic high-quality Nicaraguan hammock hand woven by Centro Social Tio Antonio, an organization in Granada, Nicargua, working to provide education, health, and economic opportunities to people in need.

For further info on Centro Social Tio Antonio: Centro Social Tio Antonio Website

Other Ways You Can Help

No money? We completely understand, trust us! You can still help the families of Los Robles. Share this campaign with your families, friends, and co-workers! 

We appreciate your support! Every dollar counts!

story: Hi Everybody! My name is Bettie Shea, and I own a small yoga studio in Mint Hill, NC called Mint Hill Yoga. I specialize in teaching therapeutic yoga, helping people to use traditional yogic tools like meditation, breathing techniques, and movement to help them overcome or control symptoms of disease. I have recently been accepted into the Yoga of Awareness for Cancer Professional Training at Duke Integrative Medicine, and tuition alone is $2000, which I don't have. I also need help funding inexpensive housing and food near the school in Durham for the week while I am in training. Here is a link to the school website you can take a look at for more details about the training and the benefits to me and the people I serve. http://www.dukeintegrativemedicine.org/professi... Training is the week of June 22-28, 2015. Any funds I receive will be put toward this schooling and its related costs. I really appreciate your consideration.

story:
Yogis Can Help is a non-profit group fundraising to teach yoga in Haiti. We traveled to Cange this past January to teach yoga to cancer patients and staff members at a Partners in Health Clinic. Our first trip was a great success and we can't wait to share our love of yoga with the patients again. This time, we are going to lead a teacher training so that the people of Haiti can continue to share the gift of yoga. We are studying Haitian Creole and have taught numerous yoga classes and workshops to fundraise. Now were asking for your help so we can bring supplies for our teacher training down with us and pay for our acommodations. 

YCH consists of a group of friends:Veronica Rottman, Danielle Robinson, and Diana Oppenheim.  We are certified, passionate yoga instructors from Chicago with a love for helping others heal and grow through the power of yoga. Our aim is to bring the healing components of yoga to those underserved.  We are so grateful to be able to spread yoga love with the support of our community. We thank you in advance for any contributions, whether they are financial or simply some positive vibes.

story:
My name is Anton Kodra and I am part of a non-profit organization associated with the University of Utah and the Bennion Community Service Center called Running Forward. This is an awesome program that takes place in underprivileged communities around Salt Lake County. We go to local elementary schools and train 4th and 5th grade students to run and teach them valuable life lessons to better their future outlook. We are practicing every week with them right now to help them reach their goal of running in a 5K at the end of the school year. This program teaches the kids self-confidence and the importance of exercising and being healthy. We teach them weekly lessons on subjects such as finances, choosing good friends, and academic goals. I will be running in the SLC Half-Marathon this spring to raise money for 150 youth in Running Forward. Contributors will have a huge impact on these amazing kids. Most of them will never get the chance to run in a fresh pair of Nikes, Asics, or any other new running shoe. The money raised will go towards purchasing new running shoes and program shirts for the talented young kids who complete their 5K race. It will also be a message of encouragement to help these youth reach their full potential.

 

So, I am asking for any donation at all, as every little bit helps. If the kids all had bigger feet, I would donate my shoe collection. I need to raise $500 to contribute to my organization’s needs. The money will go towards making this year’s program shirts for Running Forward and also to purchasing many pairs of new running shoes. These kids are great and they need your help! What’s more exciting than donating towards a cause that helps our community’s youth? There will be perks for donating to our program. You will be able to send messages of encouragement, get race updates, and be invited to help with the Sports Days and training for our 5K race. The goal is set at $500, but as I said before all donations count and even if I don’t reach my entire goal, the funds will still be put to use for our organizational needs.

 

This project is an excellent way to keep the youth in our community active and engaged. A lot of them may come from “rough backgrounds” with a negative outlook on life and their future. This project helps motivate them to set and accomplish goals that are important in their lives and to their future success. We teach them simple life lessons, which go beyond the basic math and reading they learn in the classroom. We apply what they learn academically to real world situations and examples. As a pre-med student, one of my goals and visions on becoming a doctor is to promote public health and health awareness, especially in youth. Health and exercise are very important and can lead to a better quality of life. These kids are awesome and have a lot of talent and potential. I see the next Alan Webb in the group, and some of these kids will be faster than I ever was.

 

I appreciate your time and consideration. Even if you can’t contribute funds, there are still ways to help! Spread the word about Running Forward. This is a great program affiliated with the University of Utah. Make some noise about youth programs in your area, and see what you can do to help! Again, I appreciate your consideration and contributions to this great program. There is nothing better than giving a kid a high-five after he tries his hardest in practice and achieves his goals and starts to change for the better.

story:
September 2015 update: Since we did not raise all of the funds we needed to raise last year to complete the film in 2015. We have started a new Healing ALS campaign to raise the remainder of the funds so we can complete the Healing ALS film and book in 2016. Please help support the new campaign so that people diagnosed with ALS (PALS) and their families will not have to wait another year for this life-saving information. The link to the new campaign:

http://igg.me/at/healingals2015     


*******Thank you all of our supporters and thank you Indiegogo! We have a great start on our film! Please see the latest film updates at http://HealingALS.org  *******



 People diagnosed with ALS today have a right to know that there are
treatments available now that can successfully slow, stop or reverse ALS!

"I think about how my life would have been different if this information had been available when I was diagnosed.  Knowing that people are healing would have been a source of inspiration and hope, but knowing what they were doing would have been life changing." --Dawn McCrea diagnosed ALS 2002

The people in the film were deteriorating after their ALS diagnoses. Now they are getting better. Some were in wheelchairs or couldn't speak. They continued to research, tried various therapies, made changes, and worked through the many ups and downs of this devastating diagnosis. There are effective treatments for ALS today, the proof is here. Please contribute so all can know about it.


They were given 2 to 5 years to live. They were told there is nothing you can do, go home, get your affairs in order and enjoy the time you have left.

With time, effort, ingenuity and persistence, and with the help of resourceful doctors and other practitioners, these determined people found different ways to heal.



They defied the doctors, and are healing. They believe others can do the same. They are getting better, not worse and some have completely healed. They are sharing what they did to heal so that others may benefit.

If they can do it, how many others diagnosed with ALS can do the same? How many more lives, families and futures can be saved?

Our documentary is dedicated to telling these stories to publicize this life-saving innovative approach to treat a diagnosis of ALS so all can benefit. Please contribute.


Featured In The Documentary

They are ALS Survivors. They have proven ALS can be reversed. Let's bring modern medicine up-to-date and show the world what can be done today for those diagnosed with ALS.



They were diagnosed with ALS yet they will not die of ALS. They will likely die of old age!

Many were diagnosed by top neurologists at major medical centers. They were not "misdiagnosed". Their neurologists gave some only six months to live, others several years. Why didn't they die? How did they reverse their symptoms? Our film will detail what they did to reverse their symptoms and survive ALS and the science behind it.

Who We Are

"We believe this documentary film can give hope and answers to those diagnosed with ALS and their families. The technology exists today that can slow, stop or reverse ALS progression. Please help us get the word out."


Also featured: Doctors and other experts

These ALS survivors were told, like many others, that there is no cure for ALS. yet they have shown with the use of natural and holistic treatments that ALS can be reversed. Below are some of the practitioners who supported them.


ALS (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis) is complex. It is defined as a progressive neurodegenerative disease that affects the nerve cells, in particular the motor neurons in the brain and spinal cord, usually resulting in death. There are different causes, different types, different factors involved. ALS can progress frighteningly quickly or relatively slowly. It is also known in much of the rest of the world as MND, or Motor Neuron Disease.


Where your money is going

Some people ask us, "Why do you need so much money to make a documentary film?" Here are some of our expenses:

  • Travel and shooting costs. The people we need to interview--those who have reversed ALS and their doctors are from around the US, as well as Canada and Mexico. We have a list of about thirty more people to interview including those diagnosed with ALS, key people involved in their healing, doctors, and scientists. Sometimes interviews take place over more than one day.
  • Transcripts. We will have probably close to 200 hours of footage when we are finished and that all needs to be transcribed.
  • Editing costs.
  • Computer upgrades and hard drives to store all of our video for the documentary.
  • Equipment rental for any equipment we don't have.
  • Narrator.
  • Script consultant.
  • Graphics.
  • Music and sound.
  • Post-production including color correction and digital mastering.

All of the funding we receive from the campaign will go to expenses directly related to the film, and providing the perks. If we are not completely funded then we will do as much production as possible and then do another campaign. If we get more funding than we need then we will be able to make the film even better and be able to put money into promoting it at film festivals and in other ways.


The Impact: Success that is Paving the Way for Others with ALS to do the Same

People diagnosed with ALS are told that when they lose a motor neuron it will never grow back. Steven Shackel was unable to walk and had severe muscle wasting. Today he can walk, work in the garden and do chores.

----------------

Kim Cherry could no longer play golf because of his severe bulbar ALS symptoms. He was having trouble breathing and walking. Even getting from one room to another was exhausting. This picture was taken after Kim recovered functionality. Today Kim can again walk 18 holes of golf. 


----------------

Butch Machlan kept a chart of his progress as his health was improving. His progress is especially significant because his mother died of ALS and he was deteriorating until he began his protocol. Please click on "Gallery" to see Butch's chart and is proof that ALS symptoms can be reversed.


-----------------

Craig Oster had severe muscle wasting and loss of body fat. Both his muscle mass and his body fat have improved over the last five years.

 

Please help us get the word out:

  1. Please share this link with your email lists.
  2. Please tell friends, families and colleagues about our campaign and send them a link
  3. Please write a blog on it if you can
  4. Please share via Twitter and Facebook

Thank you!

story:
Our Story

FIRST OF ALL see here how it works!!!!!! We're a non profit organization, born by the joint effort of patients, relatives and oncologists to raise atention on a new cancer treatment, already tested that is giving extremely important results on cancer treatment, but is very little sexy for industry and, over all in Italy, contrasted by strong interets. 

Martina, in the photo, is the young girl who started everything, discovering new properties of zebrafish extracts. She's ill and fights with courage and love for life.

We want to raise 5000 $ to make a proteomic study on zebrafish embryos extracts. We don’t ask you to believe our words, but our internationally published, scientifically peer-reviewed papers. On this section of our Italian website you can download english scientific papers.

It started working (better than chemos) on liver cancer, and we’re finding every day new applications. We don’t want to do business, just research and low cost care. See here how it works


The Impact

See here how it works!!!!!!

We want to empower the treatment, mechanisms by wich this strange and simple extract is working. We want to isolate the active agent, if we do it, we can start a concentration of just what works and explain why these substances are able to revert in 20% of the cancer patients their disease to a normal phenotype. We hope to improve that percentage (that already now is better than Big Pharmas chemos). See: scientific papers, downloadable at http://www.redonda.it/portal/IT/handle/?page=stampa_rassegna


What We Need & What You Get

We will pay for Bologna University proteomic laboratory. If we don't reach our goal you can ask your money back writing us at redonda.onlus@gmail.com. You will know new results by our website where we're going to publish the amount of money we spend monthly. 5000$ is the minimun to make a new step ahead and it's the fee to give the laboratory.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your people to look at the scientific section of our website, and if they're fighting against cancer to download the scientific papers we published on international journals. It's all demonstrated and they can share it with their oncologists. Just tell them to write us for any doubt.

FIRST OF ALL see here how it works!!!!!! We're a non profit organization, born by the joint effort of patients, relatives and oncologists to raise atention on a new cancer treatment, already tested that is giving extremely important results on cancer treatment, but is very little sexy for industry and, over all in Italy, contrasted by strong interets. 
Martina, in the photo, is the young girl who started everything, discovering new properties of zebrafish extracts. She's ill and fights with courage and love for life.
We want to raise 5000 $ to make a proteomic study on zebrafish embryos extracts. We don’t
ask you to believe our words, but our internationally published, scientifically
peer-reviewed papers. On this section of our Italian website you can download english scientific papers.
It started
working (better than chemos) on liver cancer, and we’re finding every day new
applications. We don’t want to do business, just research and low cost care. See here how it works


The Impact
See here how it works!!!!!!
We want to empower the treatment, mechanisms by wich this strange and simple extract is working. We want to isolate the active agent, if we do it, we can start a concentration of just what works and explain why these substances are able to revert in 20% of the cancer patients their disease to a normal phenotype. We hope to improve that percentage (that already now is better than Big Pharmas chemos). See: scientific papers, downloadable at http://www.redonda.it/portal/IT/handle/?page=stampa_rassegna


What We Need & What You Get
We will pay for Bologna University proteomic laboratory. If we don't reach our goal you can ask your money back writing us at redonda.onlus@gmail.com. You will know new results by our website where we're going to publish the amount of money we spend monthly. 5000$ is the minimun to make a new step ahead and it's the fee to give the laboratory.


Other Ways You Can Help
Tell your people to look at the scientific section of our website, and if they're fighting against cancer to download the scientific papers we published on international journals. It's all demonstrated and they can share it with their oncologists. Just tell them to write us for any doubt.

story:
Short Summary

Everyone's life has been touched by cancer somehow.  For me, it was my father. For my daughter, it was the grandfather she never met.

As the mothers of four Grade 3 daughters, we feel it is important to instill in them the value of giving back and supporting those who need our help.  As a result, we will be walking in this year's Relay for Life on June 1st for the Canadian Cancer Society.

What We Need

We wanted to choose an ambitious, yet attainable, goal.  If each mom & daughter on the team raises $250, we will reach our goal.

The Impact

In addition to supporting a great cause, we will be teaching our children an important life lesson: No matter how small, how young -- Any one can make a difference, make a change.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot make a financial contribution, please spread the word about this fabulous annual fundraising event:  Relay for Life

www.cancer.ca/relay
